I asked for ketchup for the now cold fries.  Not got it. We wanted a refill on our drink order that took too long the first time.  We finally had another server bring us 2 more beers.

Really sad experience.  We will not be back.

We went here for girls night and to celebrate my friend's birthday. I had the shrimp gumbo combo with the catfish po' boy. It was really good, my friend had the jambalaya and gumbo combo. The jambalaya was peppery bit still good. We ordered a chocolate cake to share berween 4 of us and it was decadent. It was also plenty big for all of us. 
The second time I came here was within a month of the first time, because my husband loves alligator and its not easy to find. It was amazing! The breading was perfectly seasoned. Try the bourbon chocolate sundae!

Absolutely delicious :) My boyfriend and I went for my birthday and enjoyed every bite!
We ordered the Cajun combination entree and a seafood po'boy (half catfish, half shrimp).

If I had to choose a favorite, I'd choose the Crawfish étouffée - but I'd have it all again. 

We will definitely be going back. Staff was friendly and place had a nice ambience.

We loved going to this place when it was still at town and country. Didn't realize it was so close to our home! Food is great! Had one of the combos and it was worth while! Talk about trifecta -- gumbo, jambalaya, and étouffée!

I haven't popped into a Baby Kay's since the good old days, when we restaurant staff would go hang out and drink with Remy after our dinner shifts near his original location in Scottsdale.  I remember the food being pretty awesome back then, but life and distance just got in the way of me ever going back............until last week!

This time, after checking my Yelpy app for some new local joynts to try, I found this location and decided it was time to see how things have been on the bayou front.

My Scottish buddy and I head over and are quickly attended by the oh so very lovely Heather, and are offered some yummy vittles for dinner.  The vibe is cool, the music perfect and the food...............delicious, with a slow heat build up in every bite.

Looking forward to my next visit, and hopefully, we get to see Heather AND her twin sister, for double the pleasure, like Wrigley gum, only much better eye candy.

We love this place, the food is incredible but for me what's more important is that the staff treat you like family. When you walk in you feel welcomed and at home right away. The wait staff are super friendly and are always quick to offer any help or advice on the menu items.  The food is awesome especially the crayfish ettoufee!

I've been going to Baby Kay's since it was at its old location by the Biltmore. Everyone is always so friendly and inviting. I've never had bad service. And of course the food is amazing. My favorite is crawfish etouffe with the dirty rice. And of course the green olive coleslaw is the best! I recommend the 3 combo with the etouffe, jambalaya, and gumbo. You get a little bit of everything in one meal. It's absolutely perfect!! All in all, great location, great food, and a great experience every time I go there.
Baby Kay's is the Real Deal!!! Great food, Great staff,Best crawfish etouffee around !! Their shirmp cocktail and the cocktail sauce will really make your eyes water but it's OHHH so good !!!

Great atmosphere and the service was great! The wings were a little disappointing after all the great reviews - we had the original and they somehow managed to lack flavor but were very tender. The duck and sausage gumbo was very flavorful and had a nice spice to it. My boyfriend had the catfish dinner with the crawfish sauce on the side. He loved the sauce! The portions are huge here but worth it.

We would have gone 3.5 stars, the food was good, the service was really good. 
The food was a bit too spicy for me, but my husband thought it was pretty good. I asked if you can order it mild and was told not at this time. 
The atmosphere was good and there was live music!

After dining in once I knew I was hooked but I just recently found out they do take-out as well! The jumbalaya is easily the best thing on the menu (green olive cole slaw is a close second...good thing they include it for my side) and the prices are right. Score!  Great service, good vibes, and the food always comes out hot and consistently delicious! I recommend Baby Kay's to everyone willing to try some real New Orleans/Creole cooking!

Service  is very good. Garlic bread  was very good . We liked their  hush puppies.  Tried their  gumbo. Best dish that they serve.  Also tried their  etouffe it was good . Also tried the  pecan pie. It was average  . . Loved their staff

AMAZING, authentic food! Service was excellent as well! 
It was our first time there and we were blown away by how great the food was...we will definitely be back!

This is the best Cajun restaurant  I. Phoenix  proper. We had the lulu wings which has a nice tangy sauce . Chicken was cooked to perfection nice and crunch and moist in the middle . I just live their gumbo.  Lots of meat and lots of spices and heat. The crawfish ettouffe is also a signature  dish. Lots of meat and lots of flavors.  Service is always attentive  and the jazz music is great background

Base on the reviews this place has received my wife and I thought we would give it a try. Wow they have the best gumbo I have eaten in years. Loved the place, the food and atmosphere were fantastic. We went for lunch and tried the combo appetizer plate to start. She had a catfish poor boy and I had the seafood gumbo. 
Can't wait to go back.

Maybe it was an off day or something for this place..  Stopped in for lunch today, it's a Saturday.  Place is in a strip mall.  Decorations are something you would see in party city around Mardi Gras time, (pretty cheesy).  Service was nice and friendly.  Now lets get down to the food part of this.  
I'm very hesitate to say but I must, it wasn't good.. Yes I've read the other reviews but I've been and lived in New Orleans and I have to say I don't think this should be called Cajun.  The flavors are so bland I couldn't taste any spice at all on anything.  Food seemed really dry like it might have been sitting awhile.
My husband and I ordered the Boudin Balls for an app.  Now those were decent.  I ordered a Shrimp Po'boy, and my husband ordered the Jambalaya.  My shrimp Po'boy had old bread and was cut in half with 4 medium size shrimps on each half., sorry not enough shrimp for a sandwich that cost nearly 11 bucks at lunch.  The Remoulade sauce only had one flavor... Horseraddish, it was super strong and was awful.  So eh on the Po'boy, it came with a side of burnt homemade potato chips, ate like one and decided to pass on the plate of them.
I felt really bad though looking at my husbands plate.  It was a stacked high rice dish with these shriveled up sausages thrown on the side of the dish.  I had a taste of his, first the rice... really dry.. Then I took a little bit of this beef jerky sausage, it was so dry and had no taste at all.  I told him he must dump hot sauce all over that dish because there is nothing going on there.  
So yeah.. not sure if it's what we ordered or what, but Flavors of Louisiana is way better if your craving Cajun food in the valley.
P.S.  My husband ordered Tea, it's wasn't Louisiana Tea, nor sweet as they make it in the south... would have been nice to have been given the option for sweet tea!

Alright.. A-hem... er, F*** I hate giving poor reviews! This place isn't HORRIBLE, but it most CERTAINLY isn't as good as what they charge for it.

I went here for lunch today because I was feeling adventurous. I felt the need for something new, and it was a toss up between Cypress Grill and this place. Unfortunately, I picked THIS place... We sat down and ordered my 4 year old the corn dog on the kids menu for $3.50. I ordered the 1/2 shrimp po'boy and chicken/sausage gumbo $10.50, and my wife ordered a chicken po'boy and gumbo of the same $9.50.

Out comes my son's corn dog.  It was nice that they brought that out quick, because kids get anxious when waiting for their food. As do some adults, I suppose... nonetheless, it was one of those frozen-type corn dogs that you can buy by the box... As soon as I saw this, my feeling for adventure was snuffed.  The food DID come out fast. I'll give them that, but it was a bit shy of good.

1/2 Shrimp Po'boy: Keep in mind, they charge $10.50 for a full sized sandwich.  My sandwich had maybe 5 shrimp on it, some lettuce and two small pieces of tomato on the side.  The horseradish sauce was, indeed, good but there lacked anything GOOD to put it on. So I just dunked my two dry pieces of bread and 5 shrimp in the sauce. Don't get me wrong, I'm not complaining about the taste.  The taste was good. but the price I paid doesn't constitute what I received.

Chicken and Sausage Gumbo: I must admit, my wife ruined this one for me.  She mentioned how it reminded her of the canned soup of the same, and, I sh*t you not, it DID taste like canned soup! the chicken was SUPER mushy, and the sausage tasted like they bought a kelbasa, sliced it up, and added it to the soup just before serving. It was not good at all.

I can't comment on my wife's po'boy, but it didn't look much better than mine. Two pieces of bread with some chicken. Meh...

That's right, I said it! Meh, Meh, Meh!!! And with that, I will be making a Meh list to put this in... Actually, I think I already have one.
So glad this restaurant is near my house.    The étouffée is delicious.   The live music is right out of New Orleans.    I'd go here once a week if I could.

The food is amazing! I like the vibe in this place as well. My favorite was the Etouffee. The gumbo was yummy as well. We also ordered the sampler platter that they had and it was to die for! The staff was very friendly as well. We will definitely come back!

Came in on a Friday night. Nikki was our server.  She was wonderful & extremely attentive . Ordered the catfish dinner and chicken & sausage gumbo.  Food was great but gumbo was very spicy. Had good flavor but he spice level was very intense. Even the dirty rice was spicy.

Service left a lot to be desired. The bartender was my waitress although I wasn't seated at the bar. So yeah.  I ordered the crawfsh ettoufe. Really good. Spicy!  The rice cuts the heat though. I give the dish 5 stars (the entrée price is $19) . The potato salad that it came with wasn't good at all. Very dry (couldn't taste any mayo) but was heavy on relish. It just was bad. The garlic bread tasted frozen. So yeah. It's ok. The 3 stars instead of 4 are for slow service (asked for more rice and waitress/bartender forgot) and the price is steep for what it is.

This place is so good that I ate here for the first time recently and came back a 2nd time 4 days later.  When you come get the LuLu Wings for an appetizer.  They are breaded, fried and drenched in a honey Tabasco type sauce that is literally finger licking good.  I'll order garlic bread just to mop up the leftover sauce with.

The first time we came here was on a Saturday night and I ordered their daily special which was the Smothered Pork Chop dinner.  It comes with a side of warm bourbon fruit cocktail and my 2 sides I chose was the dirty rice and the potato salad.  I swear the pick chop was a double cut thick chop smothered in a brown gravy.  The pork was so tender you did not need a knife to cut it.  The dirty rice had a nice kick to it and the potato salad was a nice compliment to the meal.

4 days later we came back for Happy Hour.  I had the wings again and had a shrimp n oyster poboy with house made potato chips.  A very meaty sandwich and the chips were tasty.  I can't wait to try their jambalaya next.

Another Groupon Now Deal...I'm starting to see a trend with these...mediocre food.  I had the red beans and rice which came out warm...not hot.  My husband ordered the spicy fried chicken which was VERY crispy and the brown meat was tender and juice.  The breast, however, was dry and flavorless and needed to be brined before frying just to give it something.  I won't return.  I was barely worth the "deal" but I'm glad I tried it.

I've been waiting to update my review until after I got myself back over here to try their Thursday night fried chicken.  I'm convinced there is nothing bad on this menu.  There isn't even anything just ok or mediocre.  It's all great.

My husband and I sat at the bar last night after a long day of work.  It seriously should have been Friday yesterday.  Sure felt like it.  The sign out front said, "a hurricane will take away your pain".  OK.  Two hurricanes.  And an order of LuLu wings please.  

Ah.  The world goes away.  The man and woman taking turns working behind the bar are so friendly and funny that it's hard to stay in a bad mood.  And there was a father/son pair sitting at my left elbow and they were fun to talk to as well.  This was their first visit to Baby Kay's and they enjoyed what they ate, but they were eyeballing our wings, so I gave them one.  They said, "We know what to order next time!  Those wings are delicious!"  Yes they are.  

We also ordered the fried chicken dinner which is perfect to share because it's a half chicken, 2 sides, and some garlic bread.  We got ours with the green olive cole slaw and dirty rice.  We also tried Abita's Andygator which is a helles doppelbock.  What?!?!  Somebody pinch me!  Am I drinking beer in Germany with Cajun music in the background?  Loved the dinner and the beer.  Great all around.  

Since my last review, we were also in on a Saturday night for the smothered pork chop special.  That pork chop is nothing short of amazing.  It's so tender it just falls apart, and is covered with a rich brown gravy.  Mmmm...mmmm...that's some good eatin', Clark.  I want to go back and get that for sure.  So, yeah.  Still great food and great service.  Baby Kay's has become one of our favorite places.

I've been to Baby Kay's twice in the last five years. It is good. It's not great. Today I got an oyster po-boy with fries. The oysters were great. I got a to go order and I appreciated that the sandwich wasn't full assembled so it wouldn't get soggy. That said, even after I put it together it lacked that drip-down-your-arm goodness I expect from a po-boy. The bread wasn't crusty--it was very soft. The remoulade was very heavy on the horseradish.  I like lettuce, tomato, and pickles on a po-boy. My sandwich only came with two little tomato slices. I did find the pickles hiding under my fries after I was done with my sandwich. They were really tasty--wish I had found them sooner. The fries were crispy and had Cajun seasoning. The oysters were good enough, I'll come back but I'd probably get the platter and not the po-boy.

The ONLY place in Phoenix that satisfies this Cajun girl's taste for Louisiana! I was born and raised in South Louisiana, so I def know what gumbo and boudin should taste like! This place is so on point. 
The atmosphere reminds me of one of the many neighborhood restaurants in Lafayette, LA. 
You MUST TRY the boudin balls that are served with an apricot pepper jelly. 

I drive all the way from downtown just to eat at Baby Ks!

Nice Cajun food. We started with the combo appetizer that would possibly be enough for two normal eaters. I had the crawfish etoufee and my wife had the seafood gumbo. Both were fantastic. The wine list was short, but the cab was good. We are planning to come back with our daughter. Try it if you like Cajun.

I am not a regular customer but I've eaten here numerous times over the past 10-years and have never been disappointed.  I've always received pleasant service. Bring your heartburn medication :) the food is awesome.  If your a penny-pincher, this place might not be for you.

I was excited to find this place here in Arizona. It's a small comfortable family restaurant in Mesa and embodies the soulful, cultural, and harmonious seasons of Louisiana. The food was good and I can't wait to try other options the restaurant offers. I ordered the Craw Fish Etouffe w/white rice, fried catfish and green olive Cole slaw. I wasn't fond of the Cole slaw definitely not within my taste buds but everything else was delicious. We also had hush puppies!! Loved them. 

My friend ordered the jambalaya and seafood gumbo which I was told was great but gumbo was VERY spicy. 

I ordered take out so I didn't experience any memorable customer service.

As a huge fan of New Orleans, Baby Kay's really made me feel like I was in N'awlins.  The jambalaya, hush puppies, crawfish etouffee ... and yes folks, even the hurricanes! ... were out of this world.  Happy hour every day from 2 pm to 6 pm, and they have food AND drink specials.  Highly recommend trying to get there during happy hour since it's easy to get that bill up to a $100 for 2 :)

GREAT food. 

Skip the po boy (they're just decent) and get the combo :)  yum yum yum

I felt like we were in NOLA again for a few minutes :)

I like, no, LOVE this place. The food is amazing. Hush puppies are the best I have ever had. The shrimp etouffee is consistent and amazing. This place stands out because they are 'consistently' amazing.  Did I mention this place is amazing! Huge fan for over a year. They have never served me a bad meal. Thank you for awesome food.

The major problem with this restaurant, and I've been there twice, is that the service is slow and poor, and that really puts me off.  A few nights ago I ate there with two other people and the restaurant was only about half full.  We were all very hungry, so I asked if we could have our garlic bread straight away.  Of course, says the waitress.  15 minutes later - no bread.  I asked again and it finally came out.  How hard can it be to toast bread and smear it with garlic butter????  Poor performance, especially since it was not busy.  The drinks were equally slow to come out.  I don't understand what is so complicated about pulling a draft beer!!!  The food is generally pretty good, especially the crawfish sauce you can get with your catfish - really great.  The jambalaya leaves a bit to be desired, however.  Too dry and starchy.  The red beans are good, though, as is the catfish, albeit a bit heavy on the batter.  Oh, I grew up in Cajun country, so I know how it should be prepared.

I came here last week with Michael for dinner.  I must admit that this place has been around forever and this was my first time.  Michael had been here before but it had been quite some time for him.  We both decided on the gumbo... I had the chicken and andoulle sausage with a salad for my side and Michael had the seafood gumbo with the green olive slaw.  My salad was pretty good...very basic, but the salad dressing was pretty damn good I also tasted the green olive slaw, it was pretty good also.  The best part was the gumbo... we both really enjoyed that.  We each also had a cocktail and the total was $39.00 ... that was great!

This place is amazing! Went with the coworkers. Showed up with 7. No wait for lunch, immediately got seated. The food was great! Great value! Bathrooms were SUPER clean! Good so good I forgot to take a picture until I dug in... had crab cakes and seafood basket. Loved the crab cakes and spicy mayo!!!

I am so thankful to have found this place ! I am orginally from Southwest Louisiana myself. I grew up in Lafayette and went to college there. I still have family there. But I have to say that the crawfish etouffee and boudin balls I had here were excellent ! If I could I would eat here everyday ;) I am beyond thrilled to have found a piece of home so far from my home.
Very tasty Cajun food but they really needed a lunch menu. Portions were large and way too much food for a summer lunch.

Enjoyed my sandwich & would definitely go back.  There was a live musician on the Wednesday night I was there.  While the music was great, it was a bit noisier than I was expecting, which made it occasionally hard to hear my group.  However, it was still a fun night with some high quality Cajun food.

Fun little spot! Customer service is friendly! The food was amazing! Seafood Gumbo, Fried Catfish we're very good! Strong drinks (Hurricane) very tasty! It did take a little long time for the food to come to the table, but I don't imagine that's the norm.

This place was WAY overpriced for mediocre food.  The only thing I really liked was the seafood ettouffee.  The sweet and spicy wings were not bad but tasted better heated up later.  The barbeque shrimp wasn't what I expected at all but was pretty good, maybe its better in the entree version over rice.  They were out of oysters for the po boy so I couldn't get it although I wanted to..  The gumbo and jambalaya wasn't anything to write home about.  :)

I'd hate to waste a star on this place!

I lived right outside of The French Quarter in New Orleans for 8 months. I remember the best of Cajun food and this place was far from what I remember. I'm not big on seafood but everyone at our table ordered a seafood dish and all were not happy with their entree.

What did I order? I ordered a simple Chicken Po'boy sandwich. How can a Cajun restaurant get this wrong? This place did. The chicken was placed on bread that was hard. I expected the chicken to be smothered in BBQ sauce. Wrong! The sauce was on the side. The lettuce on the side of dish that was to be used in the sandwich was a bit on the brown side. The fries were cold. Yuck!

Waitress was great. She was the best part of this dining experience. Never again.
Crawfish étouffée is fabulous!  Bluesey singer on Fridays topped off our evening.

I've been to Baby Kay's three times. The first time was probably about eight years ago, and I honestly can't remember what I ate or any details so it can essentially be ignored. The most recent visits were about a month apart and the last was today. The food is okay, but extremely overpriced and underflavored. The red beans and "rice" dish, w/andouille for an extra $1, is essentially a plate of beans with about two tablespoons' worth of white rice, plus about an ounce of their green olive coleslaw. Ok, it -was- reasonably spicy but should have been no more than about six bucks because what it really equated to was an appetizer as far as I'm concerned, and the amount of beans grossly outweighed the amount of rice. Their special today was 8 fried shrimp with dirty rice crawfish etouffee and one side. I got the coleslaw again. The amount of food, for $14, was pitiful - a half serving, essentially. And this time the flavor was just totally lacking. The full crawfish etouffee dish price is $19 which is murderously expensive and as I discovered today it just doesn't have much flavour. The dirty rice had what appeared to be minced beef in it and was light on the pepper. Even the garlic bread wasn't any better than I could have made myself with a cheap baguette from Fry's, butter and some chopped fresh garlic. I know everyone's been fapping on about authentic flavour here, but if that's what this is then I much prefer Pappadeaux. Save your money - there's no value to be had in this restaurant.

Edit 20130902: Tonight my wife made a simple meal of a packet of store-bought Tony Chachere jambalaya with some chopped up polska kielbasa sausage in it. It was delicious. Taste buds still working - check.
Well worth the drive. The best crawfish étouffée I had so far. The crawfish were so plump and juicy. And the garlic bread.... So delicious.

We love this place. The service is always fantastic and the food is just incredible.This restaurant hands down has the best crawfish etouffee. We also enjoy the Lulu wings. We have not ventured to try any other dishes, but the table next to us got the catfish and it looked oh so yummy.

Stopped here while I was in the area for something different. It was during lunch and had a break in my day. Service was prompt and good. Had the jambalaya with cole slaw and rice.  The spiciness is up there with a good Mexican dish. Rice was not the best but not the worst either, it looked like instant and had been sitting for a bit. Cole slaw...... No, I've had better at Church's Chicken. BUT, I didn't go hungry.

Was driving to get pizza for lunch and spotted Baby Kay's so I decided to try it. The friendly waitress, Andrea, recommended the lunch special, Shrimp and Crab stuffed poblano, battered and deep fried on a bed of Cajun Rice. THE DISH WAS AWESOME. I will recommend this awesome little jewel to all my friends!

This place was delicious!! The entire family went their for my brothers birthday and we all agreed that this place is awesome. Great food, authentic, good customer service, and live entertainment.. we will deff be coming back :)

Food is off da fuckin chain. Straight . The seafood gumbo is puff. The seafood etoufee is crack. And the jambalaya is straight too. Damien is on point as a server. Speedy, polite and made great suggestions. 

I'll be back soon.

This might just not be my thing because it came highly recommended from two friends.  Also, perhaps I just ordered poorly.

Tried the crab cakes.  Just okay and didn't taste very fresh.

Had the red beans and rice with sausage.  It was to spicy for me to enjoy and just was otherwise boring to me.

If you were going to reheat my 20$ etouffee, at least it should be hot, not lukewarm... 

My fiancé and I came in the knowing the price would be moderate-high. However, we were not expected to pay 40$ meals on old, reheated food and burned garlic breads... seriously my breads were burnt on one side and soggy on the other side lol. And the food was so disappointed my fiancé jokingly said the burnt breads was the best part of the meal haha. 

In addition to it, the coleslaw was a bit weird and the potato salad wasn't even as good as safeway's 

I added a star for the nice server we had. However, it would be a 2 stars. 

It s our second time and would be our last.

Decided to check this place out finally and was well worth the trip.  Traveled from Ahwatukee, which nothing is really that far but for food sometimes its not worth it.  Either way, after reading other yelpers reviews and seeing the pics for HH everyday from 2-5 figured a Saturday afternoon trip over after some shopping sounded like a plan.  As most places, a strip mall restaurant doesn't look like much on the outside.  Dark windows because of sun and a small patio but too hot to sit outside still.  First impressions was good.  Nothing spectacular for decor. Tables are well placed apart from each other, a few booths, a great use of chalkboard for specials, and a decent bar but not over stated.  Wait to be seated, which wasn't crowded so about 2 minutes before a waiter came to seat us.  Menu is simple which was where I got hopeful they actually specialize in what they cook instead of some of these places who have too many selections that all taste the same.  We ordered 1 item from the starters and that was the fritters. They were pretty darn good.  Didn't taste the oil, good corn bread mixture, could have incorporated actual corn to make them better but they served with a horseradish deep that was fantastic.  From the HH menu, we selected: Hurricane shrimp, Crab Cake, Duck and Andouile gumbo, Seafood gumbo, Crawfish etouffee, BBQ pork sliders and LuLu's wings. I've posted pics as well but here's my take - Shrimp were fantastic, 6 shrimp swimming in their honey hot sauce with a scoop of white rice in the middle.  My BF could have licked the plate.  Sauce provided heat but not where you can't taste anything else.  Crab Cake they slipped on the sage and it tasted like thanksgiving stuffing.  Not much crab so I'd pass on that one when I go back.  Gumbos were amazing!  This is where they have concentrated their efforts and KUDO's to them!  Seafood gumbo was a tad better than the duck/sausage from a fat content.  They were both prepared perfectly.  The Crawfish Etouffee was rich and flavorful and bursting with crawfish.  A must try as well.  LuLu's wings were deep fried and then sauced with the Hurricane sauce but not so great IMO.  They turned out a bit too sweet for my tastes.  But based on the consistency of the batter on the wing I bet their fried chicken is good.  The wings were a nice size but again, too sweet for me. And last but not least the pork sliders.  Great amount of pork on each slider, sauced with very well could have been the Hurricane sauce - was sweet, tangy not spicy BBQ flavor. Could taste a hint of smoked flavoring but definitely not smoked. Not a BBQ joint however so will let those slide.

My Rating - Gumbos: outstanding, Etouffee: outstanding, Hurricane Shrimp: Very Good; Fritters: Pretty good,  CrabCake:  Not so Good; Wings: Okay; BBQ Pork Sliders: Pass

Definately will be going back to try some other items on their menu!  Hope this helped someone!

I've wanted to try this restaurant for a couple years now and was finally able to make it over there last week. After I was seated, I waited quite a while(this was at 3pm) for the waitress to get my food order. I was a little preturbed by this but once she left the kitchen and got to my table, so was actually quite pleasant. I explained to her that this was my first time and asked for a recommendation. She enthuisiastically recommended the fried shrimp po'boy and chicken/sausage gumbo which I ended up ordering. The shrimp in the sandwhich was pretty well cooked, and not overdone so the shrimp were quite juicy still. Unfortunately, there just wasnt enough shrimp to fill in the bread that came with it. The gumbo was delicious and a definite highlight of the meal. 

I would recommend this restaurant, though it may not be the best value for what you get.

Great food, great bar, great server Kori. Keep it up Baby Kay's. The gumbo is delicious, the red beans and rice rock, the wings are to die for, and the fried chicken is second to none! Do yourself a favor and go get ya some!

I remember going to this place when it was still near Biltmore in Phoenix and I can't believe it moved to Mesa, and honestly....neither can my waist line! This is like ten minutes from me at ASU.

The etouffe and coleslaw are amazzzinnngggg. I day dream about the crawfish etouffe almost weekly. It has a great spice to it and is so authentic to the food in NOLA (go figure). They have specials everynight, but somehow I always manage to show up on Thursdays, and each time I go my boyfriend gets the fried chicken and I get the etouffe with garlic bread and we share. 

They also have abita and other New Orleans brews here, so you really can't go wrong coming here.

The food here is sooo good, I'm always too busy digging in to take a picture. 
The crawfish etouffee is the BEST and their po'boys are so fresh.
Genuine New Orleans flavors in the desert!

I love a good jambalaya, and this place really came through. The rice, chicken, and sausage were all delicious. Perfect amount of spiciness, and an amazing flavor.

The dinner came with a small salad, and some good garlic bread. I'll definitely be back to try some gumbo and one of their desserts, maybe the bread pudding which is supposed to be amazing.

We love the food at Baby Kays!! Tonight though we had something happen which left a bad taste in our mouths!  When my party of 6 arrived we told our waiter that we would be needing 4 seperate checks and we were led to believe that this was not a problem.When our check came he told us that it would take him too long to figure it out seperately and that we should do it ourselves on the back of the bill and write out our seperate amounts so he could give us all our seperate total! I thought thats what I was paying him to do???  NEVER IN MY LIFE HAVE I HAD TO FIGURE OUT AND SEPERATE MY OWN BILL AND WRITE IT DOWN FOR THE WAITER! If seperate checks was a problem we should have been told so at the beginning of our evening and we could have adjusted accordingly!  If we all were at 4 different tables we would have recieved seperate checks, so what was the problem! This was very annoying to me and it is unfortuanate because food was great as always and the service was great up to that point! If seperate checks are a problem then please tell your guests up front so this never happens again!! It's too bad a fun night out with friends left us in a bad mood at the end of out evening!! Will I still eat at Baby Kays?  Yes! I just hope they take this consructive criticism to heart and change things accordingly!
I went here last a year and a half ago and enjoyed the food.  Definitely would go back if in the near vicinity & in the mood for Cajun food.

Being that I am a New Orleans native, this is by far the most authentic Cajun food i have found in the valley. The wait staff is always friendly and even remember me most of the time. They serve a lot of New Orleans drinks including Abita beer. The seafood gumbo is awesome! For lunch you can get a half poboy and a cup of soup which is the perfect lunch portion. I tell anyone that asks me about finding good Cajun food to go to Baby Kay's. Can't wait until their new location opens.

I had the fettuccine with cream sauce (added chicken) it was really good. The sauce had a little spice to it and the serving size was generous. I think this will end up as my go-to dish when I come here. The hush puppies were light and crisp served with a tarter sause and a ketchup.  I did not try the ketchup because after I had the tarter sauce, I just wanted to eat as much of that as I could. I think they mixed some horseradish in it. So good. 

The restaurant had a cool, laid-back atmosphere. The music was great and so was the artwork (most of which was for sale). Service was OK but the place was not busy when we were there so I would expect it to be fine.

I'll be back. I just wish it wasn't all the way in Mesa.

Soooo close to home. I wanted to love it more. 

Good food. Great service. There was a shrimp appetizer in a horseradish sauce. Delicious. 


The waitress brought out extra dipping sauces and the fried cod was perfectly crisp.

Seafood etouffee, gumbo, jambalaya and the Baby Kay's Seafood Appetizer plate ...  YUM!!!  We got a great bottle of wine on special for $18.  The waiter, Nick, was fantastic and I wish I lived closer so I could come more often.  

They are moving to a new location and will be closed after Aug 31 until Nov sometime.
Great time in Mesa.  Nice atmosphere and friendly staff.  Crawfish etouffee was fantastic.  Generous portions. Will be back next time I'm in town.

Rib sticking red beans and rice, cold beers and a live blues guitar player. What more could you ask for. I had eaten at the Phoenix location years ago and have been a fan of the Mesa location since it opened. Don't let the outside fool you, once you walk through the door, the interior decor, smell of the foods, and sounds of the blues playing take you to another world. I have never gotten the chance to go to Louisiana so I cannot speak for authenticity of the food but it's good. From the red beans and rice to the mango habanero salad dressing, it's good. 

The Louisiana beers and bar drinks don't disappoint, and pair well with the food. 

The parking can sometimes be an issue, but most of the time, you can get in when you need to.
We are from Houston Tx and we know good food.  The drinks were good, the LuLu Wings are succulent. I love the olive cole slaw and Gumbo as well.   Excellent service as well.

Like others say, get the chicken wings! Sauce was great, but it is your personal preference to have it on the side or all over the wings. We appreciate awesome chicken and they deliver! So it was on the side for us. The sauce was great and we took some home. Also the Gumbo, I've never had gumbo before and it was a mouth full of flavors exploding in my mouth with the perfect amount of heat that makes you want more and more! Run, don't walk, get there as soon as you can! Man-oh-Man, save room for the chocolate sundae.

I've been a huge fan of Baby Kay's for years, I use to frequent them when they were by the Biltmore.
Still good cajun food, the whole Bayou atmosphere. 
I think it's a bit pricey, thats the only thing that keeps me from coming here more often.  Over all the years the food is still great!!!
I started out with their LuLu Wings (Amazing) Then went for the Cajun Combo and that was the perfect trio for Cajun food.

I've read reviews and thought I'd give it a try. For a place as well spoken of i found the service very lacking in customer service period. 9 people in there they were un-attentive to service at tables the bar received great service. Will not be returning.....
 
Food was very overwhelming as far as spice goes, 

i realize Cajun food is spicy and I've had good Cajun food but what we were informed of the spice levels poorly.

What a find. In from out of town and yelp did not disappoint here
Great food and music

I tried the gumbo, crawfish, catfish, and dirty rice and everything was perfectly seasoned and fresh. The waiter was amazing and the atmosphere relaxed. I enjoyed the live blues player and service was pretty quick.

I had seen this place for a while I stopped in it's a small personal place good is very good the service was amazing I would recommend to anyone Ricky was my server she was great. Good portions if you leave hungry it's your fault give it a try

Amazing! Recommended by a friend and so glad! Crawfish étouffée was amazzzzing, Bloody Mary perfect spicy, gumbo yummy, garlic bread yummy, and great happy hour 
Can't go wrong 
New regular spot
Heavenly hush puppies, chicken gumbo, jambalaya and crawfish etouffee. Very friendly service as well. My go to place for Cajun/Creole food.

My boyfriend and I are both from Louisiana so we were excited to try Baby Kay's. We both had the Bloody Mary which were spicy and full of veggies which we loved. He got the shrimp po-boy and I got the veggie étouffée. Both were quite good. On our second visit he got the sampler which he was less impressed with. Next time we'll stick with the poboy! No vegan options unless you are in the mood for a salad.

Etoufee is to die for! 

I've only ordered takeout. So I can't speak on the dine in experience. Everyone I've picked up food from was very friendly.
This place is amazing. The Friday/Saturday pork chop special is unlike anything I've ever had before... just make sure to get there early since it seems to always sell out early.

Word of mouth has lead me to many great dining establishments all over the valley. Tonight, I got to share one of those discoveries with my oldest son. A former co-worker introduced me to Baby Kay's Cajun Kitchen a little over a year ago. Since then, I've been back a few times to enjoy the authentic Creole cuisine.

Like me, my son has an adventurous interest in food, so I knew he would enjoy something different for dinner. We started with the Baby Kay's Sampler. This was a huge portion of deep fried goodness! It includes fries, fried oysters, fried shrimp, hush puppies, jalapeño poppers and fried catfish. Awesome variety! And considering it's a fried appetizer, you can still taste the quality of the product.

My son made a great selection for his entree. He loved (and devoured) his Pulled Pork Po' Boy. I told him it would be stuffed. And he wasn't disappointed. I've enjoyed a Po' Boy on occasion here.

I chose the daily special (Seafood Enchiladas) which our server Andrea described perfectly. She did a really amazing job too and even my son realized that her service was spot on. My enchiladas (more like mini burritos) were stuffed with shrimp and crawfish etouffee, served over dirty rice and smothered in a tequila cheese sauce. Oh my goodness! I cannot even begin to describe the flavor. And the portion was huge!

Besides great service, great atmosphere, great food and great company, what made me happy was hearing my son say he was going to have to tell his friends about Baby Kay's. Word of mouth. Pass it on!

I've been to Baby Kay's a couple of times and have sampled the catfish, gumbo and red beans and rice. The catfish basket and gumbo were so so while the red beans and rice took the gold. I think Baby Kay's needs some work on their lunch menu. I personally think that $50 for lunch for three people that didn't order any alcohol is a pretty steep price to pay for medicore food. I'm not too excited to make a third trip to Baby Kay's.
I love this place. I live in San Diego and the first thing I do when I get off the plane in Phoenix is go here. They have the best catfish po boys I've ever had.

OMG the shrimp etouffee. No really. OMG. SO delicious it's ridiculous. 

Went here the night of Fat Tuesday... so cliche I know. Got there about 5:30p. Place was packed of course. Hostess let us know the wait for a table would be about an hour and half but we could drink/eat at the bar in the meantime. Sold. 

Started out with a hurricane (it was Fat Tuesday after all) and it was pretty good. $5? Even better. 

Had an app at the bar, the crab cakes. Moist and delicious but super spicy. And I love spicy. But this was almost too much. Still, I would get it again. Yummy. 

After getting a table (yes, about an hour and half later), we ordered another app (hey, we'd been drinking for an hour and half!), the Lulu Wings. These were OK. The flavor was awesome, kind of a honey-Tabasco. But I thought they were a bit tough and dry, and I didn't like the fact that there wasn't a dipping sauce for them. Won't order them again. 

For dinner, we ordered a smorgasbord of food so we could try lots of things. I had the shrimp etouffee. See first line of this review. OMG... I was too full to try anything else at this point but the hubby liked everything he had (gumbo, red beans/rice, crawfish etouffee). 

p.s. the garlic bread that's served with everything is also delicious. 

Final verdict, unbelievable food and I can't wait to go back.  Especially so I can try the bread pudding.
Very good food.  Yum. Great device.  My favorite is crawfish ettoufee. My daughter loves the catfish with crawfish sauce. Tons of flavor.
This place is great. The green olive coleslaw is one of a kind. Get the combination plate for a good sample of everything. I will be back!

Service was top notch, the wait staff was helpful. Love the atmosphere and location, great place to arrive early and walk around or just relax on the outdoor area before your meal. There is a cigar shop a few doors down great place to grab a cigar before or after your meal but thats a whole other review. The food is authentic you'd feel like you were on the gulf coast or perhaps even in New Orleans. I had ordered the Crawfish Etoufee creamy and served on rice in case you're not familiar with the entree.  Very well done and had the right amount of spice and flavoring wasn't too spicy  or hot (heat). You definitely cannot go wrong with this place if you're taking out of town guest there or business clients.

We made a reservation for Saturday at 7pm knowing it would be busy. Our server was Martin S and he did a very good job considering he had two other large parties as well as our party of 8. While we were waiting for our meals our drinks were empty. At that time the owner checked on us and got us our refills. This was also when she informed us that Martin went to go help out the backed up kitchen. A few minutes later Martin came out and apologized for the wait. He then offered a round on the house! Although the food took a little longer to come out we were very pleased with our experience.
Pretty good place. Service was awesome and food was very good. Friendly staff and plenty to choose from on the menu.

What a great experience! Excellent service with food to match. I've had Cajun other places but they really do knock it out of the park here. The portions are very good size too. What they call a cup of soup is literally what all other places call a bowl. Highly recommended!!

I haven't been exposed to too much Cajun dining but I was thoroughly impressed with my meal. I had the gumbo and the jambalaya, both chicken and sausage, and both tasted great. I like my food spicy and rarely do I have a meal I don't think about adding hot sauce and this was one, and not because of the heat but because of the flavor and heat!

If you like spicy food then this is the place for you. I had the fettuccine in a spicy cream sauce with andouille sausage ($13.50). It comes with garlic toast and a side (I got the green olive slaw). The food was excellent and a huge portion (I took home more than I ate). The service was great. The decor was New Orleans camp (lots of skeleton stuff). 

My friend had the fried catfish and shrimp basket with fries ($12.95). The fish was fine, but the fries were just ordinary freezer bag fries. She said her food was OK.

The restaurant is clean and parking is close to the door. They have live music on Tuesday evening and the weekend evenings. There is a mix of tables and chairs and some booths. There is also a small patio area. I recommend this local business.

Some of the best Cajun food I've had in a long time. Beautiful gumbo, Po Boy sandwiches are phenomenal. Service was friendly and attentive, but not overbearing. I'll definitely come back for a little more southern goodness. :)

Had trouble finding the place, even with directions. Had to walk almost through the kitchen to get to the restroom. The food was mediocre. The waitress seemed to be in a rush & did not give me proper attention. I will not be back.

Because we are so far removed from the French Quarter my stomach rarely directs me to Cajun. Let's be honest there are few options in this town.  So this becomes the default spot to scratch the gumbo itch.  
Above average food, better service, higher than expected prices.

Pros: 
- I really enjoyed the live music

Cons:
- The service was not outstanding (our server had a bit of a bad attitude)
- Food was meh at best, I had the jambalaya which was dry, and spicy. I appreciate the heat but have had so much better. Hubby had the chicken gumbo, he thought the flavor was good but nothing special. 
- chocolate cake was a refrigerated Costco slice sold, resold for $7 a slice when the entire cake is only $16 (been a member for 10 years it's my fav choco cake so I know it when I have it).

I appreciate having a Cajun spot in the area, but I am very underwhelmed. For two our bill was over $55.
Won't return here but if anyone could recommend a truly great spot I'd be happy to check it out (:
Service was great food was horrible! Taste like it was precooked and rewarmed when I ordered the wings! Presentation was nice but the taste was awful
Fabulous food, great service, enjoyable live entertainment on a Wednesday night!!!! Great place for Cajun fare!!!

Awesome crawfish conffitte. Would highly recommend the combination player with the jambalaya and chicken/sausage gumbo and crawfish conffitte. Catfish is amazing as well. Live blues music by an older gentleman. Don't go thinking he'll blow your mind, not by a long shot. It's more about the ambiance which really makes you feel like you're in Louisiana.

came here for the second time last night and it was great!! i was pretty bummed the performer left as we walked in but it's all good (fri night at 8:30 pm) cuz the first time we were there, we got to enjoy the blues performer! i was sick all day and the only things that sounded good were a bloody mary and pasta (super weird lol) but our server ricki said their bloody marys were pretty spicy but really good! after i squeezed the lime in there, it was perfect! glad i went with her recommendation! i had the veggie fettuccine which was BOMB. but again, i was sick so only ate a few bites.. rickis team member asked if she could box it up for me so i said yes and thanked her. i didn't think she heard me when i said, "it's really good, i just don't feel well"-- which was no big deal! but i took it out of the fridge to have for brunch today and there was a little note that said, "feel better :)" on my box. it's the little things like that that make restaurants to the top of my list! ricki, thank you to you and your team member and to our server we had the first time (it was back in may but i can't remember his name)! amazing customer service from beginning to end! we'll be back for sure!

In Phoenix on Spring break vacation, we found Baby Kay's by using the entertainment coupon book we bought to use while out there. They were in the front for fine dining, and had a great coupon deal, along with a sample menu. Everything on the sample menu sounded delish, and we very much like the spice of Cajun cooking. It was a little hard to find, although we were not at all familiar with the area. We had the wings as an app. and used the Louisiana gold hot sauce, something new to us that we are having trouble finding in Ohio since we fell in love with it there. The gumbo was outstanding, and even the alfredo pasta had a spice sprinkled on top for a Cajun style kick... it was unexpected, and awesome! Huge portions - that we both had plenty to take with us for a whole other left over meal. ... the prices were great, especially with the coupon (or actually the entertainment card that they punch for fine dining restaurants). Excellent staff- close to closing for the night, and welcomed us in, and didn't rush us at all - made sure we were happy with everything we ordered, very friendly! Definitely would recommend it for any one who likes a little Cajun kick, and something different from chain restaurants...

Baby K's is a good little Cajun joint off of Dobson Rd in Mesa. Nice ambience, live music, smiling servers and very good food makes the place definitely one of the best representatives of southern food in the east valley.

I tried the fried chicken special on Thursday night and it was excellent. Huge portions, moist breast meat, crispy chicken skin, lots of spices including perfect helpings of cayenne on the chicken made the dinner great. The dirty rice is a perfect side. I also tried the gumbo and jambalaya from a friend's plate and they were very tasty as well.

Definitely a place to check out if you like southern comfort food.

I've never had Cajun food in Louisiana so I can't make a comparison even if I wanted to, which I don't.  It seems a lot of people like to complain about ethnic food being Americanized or regional styles not living up to expectations.  We live in Phoenix people-Phoenix, AZ, USA, not Phoenix, Japan or Phoenix, New York.  I have eaten Mexican food in Kentucky of all places.  Was it the style of food I am used to being a native Arizonan?  No, but I can appreciate that it wasn't bad, just someone else's interpretation.

So, the end result is I like Baby Kay's.  I've eaten here several times and never had a dish I didn't like, nor bad service.  I like that their hushpuppies actually have flavor beyond that of a wad of cornmeal.  I like the gumbo and jambalaya.  I tried the crawfish ettouffe and it was great.  I like that the potato salad is not swimming in some overly sweetened mayo concoction.

So while it may or may not compare to your version of authentic Cajun cooking, it is still a great place for a meal.

Tried this place on a whim and it did not disappoint! They had live music that complimented the Louisiana vibe. Our server, Chris, recommended lots of good stuff to us and we went with the lulus wings, hush puppies and the Tuesday special of seafood enchiladas. They have quite a few abita beers since abita is based out of Louisiana. Will be back to try the Cajun combo!

Catfish and red beans and rice. I have had a lot of fried catfish and this is great because it's lightly dusted in cornmeal so you can taste the fish. Red beans and rice, i'm no expert, but I thought it was great. Friendly quick service and a really nice clean new looking place.
I've been coming here for years...the best.  One of my favs is the lulu wings.

It was our first time there and the customer service was excellent! Our server Kayla was on top of everything and super polite. Our food came out quickly, hot and delicious. Some of the best Cajun I've has ever had! The live music was a plus. Will definitely return

Now I am not a Cajun food expert but on a recommendation yesterday I stopped in to give it a shot. I ordered the shrimp and catfish por boy and the seafood gumbo (asked them to throw a little sausage in for kicks).  I tried the gumbo and the flavors were so rich and the seafood was cooked perfectly.  Sent the por boy with husband today for his lunch after slowly reheating it. I will let you know what he thinks later.  I will be back and strange as it sounds but it just might be today!!!!

Well, if you saw my last review of this place, I said we have tried almost everything on the menu except the burger.  Well, can't say that any longer.  Last Saturday my wife and I ate there to celebrate my birthday, what a great time.  Martin was the waiter and we were able to visit with one of the owners, Heather.  Well, we thought it might have been one of the owners, it might have been two of the owners, as Heather informed us that her twin sister also was a owner, but they had never pulled the twins game!  :-)  

Anyway back to the burger, I have stayed away from it as blue cheese is not one of my favorite cheeses, but Martin recommended it so I trusted his recommendation.  So glad I did, it was outstanding, one of the best burgers I have had!!!!  Heather said it was her recipe so kudos for her for that. 

I can say once again, love this place and it is one of our go to places in the Mesa, Dobson Ranch area.

This is my neck of the woods...I was waiting to get my haircut and had a bit of sinus congestion that needed some clearing up so I figured so good spicy Cajun food should do the trick.

I got the chicken and sausage gumbo with the side of Cole slaw and an ice cold beer. The food was great just as I expected, the place was not to busy for a Saturday afternoon, I was by myself so I moseyed on up to the bar to make my order.

The bartender slash waitress seemed a bit pre occupied and in general I was not super happy with my service but to say the least I am a fan.

What? I never reviewed Baby Kay's? unbelievable!
Well, there is not much I can say because every time we go there we end up ordering the same thing! haha...

And that is the Cajun combination: Chicken Gumbo, Crawfish Etouffee, Chicken, and Sausage Jambalaya, cup of each. It comes with a side, I always get the cole slaw (which I love, it has green olives) and hubby always gets the potato salad, which he also loves.

I just checked their site and it says they are hoping to reopen on 2/2014 on the new location. Counting the days!
Try the Lu Lu wings! Etouffee is loaded with Seafood. Girls are great, friendly and quick on the serve.

Good hushpuppies. Good gumbo. Great service provided by two very cute twin sisters who I think are the Cajun owners. A tad pricey for a working day lunch crowd. I don't get a very authentic feel from the food but that's not to say it doesn't hit the spot. The decor is not much to speak of. I mainly come here because I get cravings for gumbo.

On a date here Saturday night.  We ate the crawfish etouffee and shrimp basket while listening to live jazz music.

The crawfish was definitely frozen.  It did not take fresh at all.  Compared to the crawfish etouffee I normally get in South Houston close to Galveston Bay, this would be barely edible.  However I understand we are in Valley so it is what it is.

The shrimp basket was good and the homemade chips were great.  I'd give that 4-stars.  Service was good here.

Drinks were horribly made.  I returned the hurricane and painkiller.  I felt bad after returning the first 2 drinks and kept the third (renee margarita), even though it was just as bad as the first drink.  Don't try drinks here.

If I rated this restaurant to Houston's top crawfish places, it would rate a 1-star.  If rated to New Orleans best places, it would rate a zero.

Update: I don't like wasting food as I ate a couple bites Saturday night so I brought it home. Upon heating it on the stove for lunch at noon the next day, I felt bad for the rest of the day after eating it.  Won't be coming back.  Maybe some things should be thrown away.

OMG! This Cajun Kitchen ROCKED! I have spent plenty of time in New Orleans, LA and the thing I miss most is the food!
This Cajun food is simply the best in AZ!
Everything was authentic and oh sooo good!
Not to mention, live music the Saturday night we were there.
The service was top notch! Efficient, laid back, and she never missed a beat! Typical of NOLA service!
The Etouffee & the bread pudding was the best!
You could taste the bourbon sauce in the bread pudding, which melts in your mouth! It did have coconut in it which was a bit different for me.
ALL in ALL I wish this place had a brunch.
I definitely will be back

I called in and placed an order for pick up. We order Hush Puppies, 2 order of the Lulu wings and the crawfish etouffee. 

Walked in to the bar because that's where they told me to pick up at. I sat down for a good 5-10 mins before I was even helped. This was a Friday night and an hour before closing. It wasn't that busy at all. There was three people behind the bar but none seem to notice me ?. Service issue?

Anyways I was really looking forward to trying the chicken wings. I saw pictures and it looked great. Supposedly the chicken were suppose to be sweet and spicy. It tasted like they over did it with the honey  because it wasn't spicy at all. The chicken tasted old like it's been in the freezer for months. It wasn't juicy at all and super dry. 

The crawfish etouffee was the only thing I could eat. It was my first so I couldn't compare it to other places but it had a nice kick to it and the crawfish was nice and meaty I had some pretty huge chunks of meat in there.

That's all I got I had high hopes for this place but that chicken wing ruined it.

had a little free time and saw this was new to the area, not the valley but the area. lucked out and started with Lulus sweet and spicy Tabasco wings...unbelievable. and the main course was a Cajun Alfredo. delicious. my other diners were in love with their meals as well. it's slightly pricy but you pay for the great cuisine for sure. as a self proclaimed sucker for Cajun, this hit the spot. We will be back. definite.

Baby Kay's has alright food and alright prices. Nothing from my two experiences that would blow the mind for greatness. 

I believe they have new owners now and we had experienced big ownership. 

The old owners the food was really good but the service was absolutely terrible! I mean terrible. The owners were not friendly and made you feel awkward going there, but I liked he food so occasionally still went.

With the new ownership it has changed to really great service! Unfortunately the food really wasn't spectacular so I never went back.

They just need to make good sized portions and have more flavor... It just wasn't quite enough to get us back.

Having just been to New Orleans a few months ago, I think I'm kind of ruined on Cajun food anywhere else. This place is located in a strip mall, and the building left quite a bit to be desired. There was a lot of cool art on the walls inside made by local artists that was for sale at reasonable prices. If I would've had an easy way to get a painting home, I would have bought one! 

The food was just ok. I had the crawfish etoufee which had a decent spice level to it, but it was extremely thick and had a weird texture to it that I had trouble getting past. One of the people with me ordered shrimp etoufee and it was extremely soupy and has barely any shrimp. It was a pale yellow color and looked like chicken noodle soup, which was odd compared to what I've experienced in the past. Since the rue base is usually the same for these two items, it was strange to see the color and consistency so drastically different. My friend commented that the shrimp etoufee was not very spicy after he tried my dish. Also, I will note that I was supposed to get a side dish with my entree, but it never arrived. The entree portion was huge, so I didn't miss it. However, it would have been nice since it was on the menu and I ordered it.

Overall, this isn't a bad stop and I have no idea what other Cajun places exist in this area so it's an ok option if it's your chance for some Cajun food. It definitely doesn't live up to actual New Orleans food, though, but I'm not sure if anything could!

We just happened upon Baby Kay's just days after it opened.  We have been there many times since then and it just keeps getting better and better.  The ambience is awesome and the older gentleman that provides the live music is delightful.  You can not find a better place to eat with a warm, friendly atmosphere and to top it off - Baby Kay's has the best catfish in AZ!.

4 stars because it didn't quite beat my absolute favorite Cajun restaurant, but that doesn't mean it wasn't awesome! 

I was impressed with the duck and sausage gumbo during my first visit to the place - the meat was high quality and it had a more unique flavor to the gumbo that I hadn't had before, but definitely liked! 

My wife had the jambalaya a la carte - her personal favorite - and ordered a side of crawfish sauce to pour on top of the jambalaya. She was raving over it! Her recommendation is, if you like crawfish, THAT is the way to do it!! If not, the jambalaya by itself is absolutely delicious! 

We will certainly go back. They have awesome sounding specials including tender pork chops, and seafood enchiladas. We are also excited about the live music. Happy hour deals are great as well! This place may become a new favorite for sure!

My co-worker took me here and I'll forever love her for it. 

Best. Gumbo. EVER.

And the garlic bread. And the shrimp cocktail. And the crawfish. 

I think I know what I'll be eating for lunch tomorrow. You should too!

This review is based on one visit at 2pm in the afternoon, so maybe not the best time of day for top notch food. Was in the area and had been wanting to try this place based on other reviews. Ordered a cup of seafood gumbo that was priced at $6.50 for happy hour and a oyster Po'Boy sandwich which was about $13. Received a small cup of gumbo with several tiny pieces of shrimp. The flavor and heat level were good but way overpriced and disappointing overall. My wife's chicken and sausage gumbo at least had lots of meat. Po'Boy was equally disappointing and overpriced. Came out not assembled so you had to do that yourself. Bun was cheap light weight bun probably store bought. The sandwich included about 6 or 7 tiny oysters, one tomato sliced in half, couple pickles and some shredded lettuce. The sandwich itself was only about 7 inches. I could hardly taste the oysters for the thick cheap bread. If you want a good Po'Boy try "Flavors of Louisiana". Their Po'Boy is outstanding.

I work right around the corner from this place and it seems to be out go-to watering hole to get hammered and eat spicy food.  Not that we're picky on the getting hammered part, but the food here is damn good.  I'm not really a cajun food person to begin with, but there a few awesome things about Baby Kay's that you can't get just anywhere.  

1) Seafood Burrito on Tuesday nights - holy mother of goodness...I'm not sure how much of the ocean is actually thrown in that tortilla, but it's fantastic.  There's a ton of cheese, cream sauce and I'm sure a ton of other uber-healthy ingredients.  Amazing.  If you've never been here before, you should hit up Tuesday nights. 

2) Friday/Saturday Pork Chop - again, not really a pork chop person.  I wouldn't go to a restaurant and scan the menu for a pork chop...but this one is INSANE.  You don't need a knife...it's so moist (I hate that word, but I'll reserve the right to use it when talking about Baby Kay's pork chop) and juicy I really want to curl up and die a happy person after consuming half a pig.  Yum is all I can say to that visual.

Yes, they're kind of pricy, but it's not outrageous.  I've had the gumbo and the sampler platter too, all of which are delicious.  The bar is great, I notice they serve a lot of beers on tap, but they also have a full bar that I've taken advantage of multiple times.

Also - during the week they have a guy (who may or may not be  homeless, it adds to the luster) who plays jazz music inside the restaurant and it's great.  It's like Enya when you're in a massage, it really makes you feel as though you might be in Louisiana for the night.  Thankfully, you're not, b/c that place sucks.

Try it out and go on a Tuesday or Friday/Saturday night!
I LOVE this place!  Great gumbo and delicious home made potato chips.  Lots of flavor and a perfect lunch spot.

This is the best Cajun resturant in Arizona. I've lived in Louisiana before and this is as close as it gets for AZ. I had the crawfish ettouffe and its was awesome and the most authentic I've had since living in Louisiana. My wife had the sampler and she loved it. The atmosphere is great. The live music added to the experience. It was kinda loud though. The waitress was kind of wierd. I would recommend this to anyone looking for some good  cajun food. It is on the pricey side but its worth it.
Some authentic Cajun flavors. I have family in NOLA and visit whenever I can. This measures up for giving me a flavor of the city 2000 mi away.

Amazing cajun southern Louisiana dishes. Crawfish etouffe comes with alot of crawfish and a bit spicy but delicious. Half soup gumbo and catfish sandwhich for a great price. Crunchy fish packed with just enough spicy. Came for lunch to try out and plan to go back. The menu said they had 2 locations, tried Mesa and next on list is Scottsdale. The dirty rice is to die for and they have live entertainment on Fridays and Saturdays. I approve of this joint!

Came to this restaurant after finding it by mistake.  What a quaint little place...more quiet actually in the  bar area...at least on a Tuesday.  Food was good, prices not so bad.  We had an appetizer sampler, the reason it's CAJUN...hot and spicy most of it.  I LOVED the crabcake so much i ordered the "Seafood burger".  It was FABULOUS.  My husband had the beef Po'Boy, not bad he says.  The Live music was a nice touch, not too loud, and better than the same ol same ol you get at other restaurants.  My only complaint...not complaint really just strange..was going into the kitchen to use the restroom.

nothin' to boast about. they need to season the crawfish with spices and not hot sauce. that goes without saying. which leads me to say i don't really dig what they're puttin' out with the crawfish boil.  being a southerner out of place sucks one in when one sees a crawfish boil is being put on...  boy, was i the one put on.

Conveniently located in the center of the East Valley and worth the trek from the West Valley, Baby Kay's does Cajun Cooking like it is done in restaurants and back yards from Houma to Bossier City!  This is true low country cooking, right here in The Valley of the Sun! 

If you are a Cajun you will know and appreciate all of the traditional cooking here.  I need not tell you what it tastes like, you grew up on this stuff.  If you are new to Cajun Fare, this is the BEST representation of Cajun food you will find anywhere west of the Sabine River.  Do not miss an opportunity to eat and drink here.  They have all of the standard beers and some Louisiana Specialties! 

Service is Great!
Food is OUTSTANDING!
Atmosphere is classic French Quarter!

Bring a friend, bring a date, bring your family but most of all BRING YO SELF and have a hot bowl of Cajun Cookin!

Baby Kay's old location back in the Town and Country area never disappointed.  I was afraid after the move, they wouldn't be worth the huge drive to get out there.  THEY ABSOLUTELY ARE!

Same great atmosphere.  Great service and the food is as good as it ever was.  I gotta get my Cajun on about once every other month.  We will definitely be back.

Great food to try:
Etouffe
Gumbo
Po-Boys
Boiled Craw-fish (in season)

I like Baby Kay's for a number of reasons

1.Its locally owned
2.Good patio
3.Friendly Staff
4.Exceptional happy hour deals.
5.Great Food!

I've had just about everything on the menu at one point or another and there isn't too much that will disappoint. The Gumbos and Jambalaya are delicious. The po boys are... Well, they're po boys. By their very nature they are just plain 'ol bread and seafood. Avoid the Shrimp Remoulade unless you REALLY, REALLY looooove horseradish and mayo.  The green olive slaw is fantastic and so are the hush puppies. Try the Lulu's wings if you like a spicy/sweet wing. The food overall is fantastic, comforting, well seasoned and filling.

The staff is knowledgeable about the menu and willing to answer any questions you may have. They are always friendly and accommodating. Quick they are not. But the food is outstanding and everyone is always so nice, I don't care that my dining experience is usually a little slow.

My boyfriend and I come here maybe once a month. Its in a great location and reasonably priced. Love this place.
Best restaurant as far as service and the food is great! Service has always been exceptional and environment is super laid back and welcoming. Love it. And... the food is really good.
I ordered the Cajun Combination and it was AWESOME. If your close by you have to check this place out, if your not close by you need to make the time to go here!
Had the half catfish sandwich and chicken & sausage gumbo and it was fantastic!!!! Excited to have another great local place to visit for lunch and dinner in Phoenix. :-)

Now this is some good grub! Mom, my bf, and I came for lunch. After our meal my mom complimented me on choosing the restaurant and said we would have to come back. Mom and I both highly recommend the fried catfish. It is the best we ever had tasted. It melts in your mouth. Also, the fried oysters are a MUST. And of course, do not leave until you try the green olive cole slaw. I love my southern cookin'! Can't wait to return and have another bite of catfish!!

Had my wife & a friend in for her birthday last night.....Susan enjoyed her Seafood Enchilada so much, she is having again  it for breakfast today.....Thanx to Baby Kay's for making my wife's  day extra special !

While everything we had was delicious, its kind of expensive for what you get. 

Etouffe, gumbo, jamabalaya, YUM.

We got a fried sausage appetizer that was... interesting. Not bad, just...different. I'm always down for new and different. Prob wouldn't order again though.

I think my only disappointment is in the limited menu. Various Catfish, etouffe, gumbo, jamabalaya, po' boy, and salads. That's about it. 

The previous Cajun business that was in this location was, IMO, superior. Bigger menu variety with better prices. I'm sad that its gone. It was damn good, but again, so is this. 

Overall, yum!

Can't say enough good things about this place!!! How have we not visited before?? Sweet tea, duck & andouille gumbo, lulus wings, catfish basket and shrimp fettuccine were all exceptional and delicious! Service was perfect. This is now our go to spot for date night. Love everything about it. Thank you!!!!!!

This place has its hits and misses for me.  In generally the staff was friendly and pretty quick. The beer selection here is simply not good; they carried only one ipa from Abita,  and it was marginal at best.  

We shared an order of hush puppies and the cajun combination plate with seafood etouffe, chicken and sausage gumbo and jambalaya. The hush puppies were super delicious! The combo plate however left us both wanting. We both loved the etouffe, thought the jambalaya was just okay and didn't like the gumbo at all. I tried a few times but there is some sort of spice that was sweet and overpowered the dish. 

We did enjoy the live music and the very relaxed atmosphere. I won't be running back here, but might try the etouffe again sometime.

The service here is awesome! I can honestly say that I'm not much of a Cajun person, but met some friends here (I've only had Cajun literally 3 times in my life).... and I was skeptical. However, once we walked in, the decor is fun, there was live music playing, and the service was absolutely stellar. I really enjoyed being there and the servers  were very helpful when assisting me making a food choice!
Amazing food, great atmosphere, excellent service. I love Cajun food and this was top notch, the seafood gumbo was delicious!!!! First time here and we will definitely be back!!!!

THIS PLACE IS AWESOME!! My wife and I live in the neighborhood and have been driving right past this place for years and never stopped, but... a friend of ours went on and on about how good it was so we checked it out. The food was great the staff is amazing. We've been back several times and have always had a great experience. Authentic Cajun food and very reasonable prices. Live entertainment really made the atmosphere.

I was really excited to try this place we went and picked up an order to go we live about 20 minutes from the restaurant and when we got home to sit down and eat our food we'd found a hair in it.  we called the place and told them about the situation and they were willing to give us a free pasta but After experiencing that it was just not worth going back.  the customer service was great I'm pretty sure they don't put hair in everybody's food, stuff happens but the proper precautions should be taken to prevent that.

This place is sooooo good. 
First of all, the live music is great. It's a little loud if you are looking to have a large group. The food though, that makes up for anything you could ever find wrong. Seriously, it's that good. 

I tried the chicken and sausage gumbo, the jambalaya, and the crawfish étouffée. All three were amazing. The étouffée was to die for. I could have eaten that for hours. It came with garlic bread and salad. The garlic bread is killer too. Seasoned perfectly. The salad was great. Tried it with a mango habanero dressing.

Service was outstanding. For a group of 20 people, they served us beautifully as if we were a small crowd. Overall an absolutely fantastic place. 

We went with a large group as part of our Friday night foodies group. There was not one person who didn't rant about how good everything was. We have been to a variety of over 20 different Restaurants and this was by far everyone's favorite. Some even said we should stop going to other places and go here instead EVERY WEEK.

Don't just think about going here. Get the keys, jump in your car and go! It's just that good.

I love Baby Kay's like pirates love stealing. It's good enough to wipe clean the memory of taking a horrible girlfriend there for our first date. The craw fish ettouffe is something I have to stop to contemplate each bite of because I struggle to comprehend why it's so delicious. The gumbo and jambalaya are also stellar. I like to merge all three in the Cajun Combination. 

They make a raspberry vinaigrette there that deserves it's own paragraph and is mandatory on your dinner salad. 

Another fantastic creation here is the apricot habenero glaze that one would think would over-power a chicken salad, not the case. Now I know most of you see the h-word and imagine terrible pain, this dish is not prohibitively hot, it manages to catch the flavor of the much maligned pepper and only a fraction of its fire. 

 If you happen upon Baby Kay's  on a day when the special is seafood enchiladas, get them and call me for a refund if you anything less than amazed. 

 Staff is pretty low key and nice here. Not a good call if you're in a hurry, but worth being late over. I usually sit at the bar if minutes are precious and outside if my time is my own. For what you get the prices are very reasonable.

Wow!!  Very impressed and stoked to have found great cajun food out in the east valley!  Their lulu wings were the best I've ever had and the fried catfish with crawfish etouffee was also amazing. My wife got the gumbo which was great as well. We'll definitely be coming back!  By the way, the service was also perfect!  Everyone made us feel welcome and it had a great family feel to it.

Their food was all the same. Hot cayenne pepper. No depth of flavor or skills. Deep fried hot food.  If that sounds like you, you will love this place.  Even their cole slaw was pepper laden. My son who loves it all hot voted never to return. Just no flavor to go with the pepper. So sad. I love southern food.

I love this place. The chicken, andouille sausage Jambalaya is great. So is the crab or crawfish etouffee. Between March and June they have crawfish boils. get a couple of pounds as an appetizer and go to town on them. Dont forget to suck those heads!

Tried this for first time. We had the catfish dinner. Food was excellent. Service was a bit slow considering that the dinner rush was over. Prices a little high I would have given a five except for service and prices.

So I was here Tuesday night, the first time in a year and prior to that it had been over 7 years. This place used to be packed! Even a year ago it had a decent crowd. When we arrived.. one table was sat with a child running and screaming through the dining area. Because of that we chose the bar. 2 guys at the bar that's it. Needless to say our service was good, how can it not be right? Started with BBQ shrimp.which was realy good but not BBQ, it was more of a spicy lemon, which was fine because the server explained that. Had I expected BBQ I would have been disappointed. Garlic Bread Great..Hush puppies a little over done but still good. Followed it up with the Bourbon Chocolate Sauce sundae..um yumm. So al in all food no complaints whatsoever. Atmosphere.. there was none. We might as well have been in a one horse town. While we were there the guys left and 2 business like women took their place at the bar. What was sad was the people watching. One of the women was just short of bragging how she used to go there all the time and how she knows all the employees...went out of her way to get the bartenders name and introduce herself like she was somebody. It was sad. She was name dropping herself! Food great.. atmosphere 'nil it was depressing..Its my opinion that unless they change up their location to something with more foot traffic (Mill Avenue would be perfect for this place... other spots such as Desert Ridge, Fashion Square, Westgate even..)they're going to waste away. Town & Country Plaza just isn't what it used to be and it's sad because their food deserves the attention, it really does.

Had the 1/2 po'boy and cup of gumbo. Delish! Slight bitterness in the gumbo, but mixed in a little of that mayo/horseraddish it made it great. Nice place for lunch, sat outside in the perfect March weather.
Amazing service and food. Very clean restaurant. I had the catfish and it was perfectly cooked. If you like Cajun food you will love this.  Awesome restaurant, highly recommend.

This was our second time coming here and as usual it was delicious. My wife ordered a painkiller and I had a hurricane, both of our drinks were strong and well done. I had the catfish sandwich with a bowl of chicken & sausage gumbo. I loved everything about it including the hush puppies I almost forgot to mention. My wife had a bowl gumbo and of course loves it as well. This is a place that makes me love living in the east valley.

Really satisfying meal with delicious flavors and dishes. 

We ordered the seafood gumbo, sausage gumbo, etouffe, jambalaya, and everything was 5-star worthy. Our server was also really attentive and gave us some great recommendations with the New Orleans beers.
