I wish they were at a better location, because they deserve to be busier with such great food. 

Looking forward to coming back!

Went here after a long hot day of logistical business. We had the chicken and sausage gumbo and their cajun burger. Both were very good. Spicy! I liked it but my nose ran a lot. It has a habit of doing that.... the carmelized onions and bleu cheese with the sausage in the beef patty all rolled up into one nice bite. The drinks were great, too! The gumbo seemed pretty authentic and was very tasty. I would recommend this place.

Spicy, tasty Cajun food with friendly, Southern atmosphere. 

I came here with family for a birthday and arrived late to a tray of fried everything. I'm not a huge fan of fried food, so I immediately became concerned. That said, I ate some of everything, and it was all pretty tasty.

But the entrees are where it's at here. I had the Cajun Combination, which included jambalaya, crawfish etoufee, and gumbo. The jambalaya was decent. I tried the duck and andouille sausage gumbo, and the duck was really tender and tasty. The etoufee was the highlight of the trio. The crawfish was plentiful, and the sauce was tasty. Oh, and the vinaigrette option for the salad was excellent! There's a nice, spicy kick to most of the dishes. Just right for me (granted, I'm a bit of a pepper belly). I also tried a couple bites of the catfish dish with crawfish, and it was fantastic! The catfish was juicy and tender inside and crispy outside. Perfect! 

There was some nice live music for part of the meal. The service was decent and friendly. 

Great option for Cajun!

Crawfish etouffee with garlic toast, a side of red beans and rice, a large carafe of iced tea, with key lime pie for dessert. That's what I had for lunch on Friday. I had forgotten how spicy Cajun food is and was only able to finish half of my meal, but the crawfish etouffee was G.U.D. good!

Serena will take care of you!

Enjoyed the catfish dinner the cornbread batter was light and not heavy on salt. They have a guitar/violin player who plays along with recorded music ala karaoke. He plays a good mix of instrumental music. Service was good and prompt. The only negative I had was the standard sauce that came with catfish was a horseradish very potent. Lucky there was a bottle of pepper sauce on table saved the evening.  There are additional sauces available but they cost extra. Green olive coleslaw was good. We will be back

This place is killer! The staff is awesome! The menu unreal! Bar is well stocked, and the waits are reasonable. Live music takes you straight back to New Orleans. The smothered pork chop special is something I recommend every time we take friends and when they order something else they always steal mine. It's a special Friday and Saturday I believe.
We had the Cajun combo and catfish/shrimp po'boy sandwich. It was to die for, I haven't ate here in over 11 years and it's EXACTLY how I remember it!!!
Delicious food need more servers so they can visit table to see if anything is needed. Music was nice place was clean and food was fresh

I love this place. Love the staff. Live music, happy hour from 2-6 M-F, 2 -5 on Saturday. Love the menu. Crawfish étouffée is delicious. I've also tried alligator here. It was awesoooommme!  Come for a drink stay for the atmosphere. Become a regular because your always welcome

Went there last night for my wife's birthday (Friday).   Took our 1 girls (ages 6 and 5). 

They had a blues guitarist that was pretty good and girls enjoyed it. Food was great.   Prices reasonable.  Would definitely return.  

Service so so.  Had a 6:00 pm reservation, arrived at 5:55 pm and was seated at 6:15 pm.

Ok...I'm not from New Orleans or (N'awlins) but I have had authentic creole.  Right out of the gate the sweet tea needs work...seriously if this is supposed to be southern you'll need to improve it quite a bit (let this southern boy know if you need some help).  The hush puppies came out and I was immediately nervous because they smelled like they were burned, however they were very crisp and perfect consistency on the inside with great flavor along with horseradish sauce.  I ordered the cajun combination and everything was great. I'm not going to say that the gumbo is incredible in fact it was a touch bland but it was still passable.  The jambalaya was flavorful and was much better than I expected.  Now, the pièce de résistance...the étouffée was phenomenal!!! I have been searching for a place that does this right and I have found it!  I would not usually give a high rating because of the few inadequacies but the étouffée blasted this place out of the park for me.  The service was prompt and friendly and major kudos (maybe small to some but it is that little extra) they packed my leftovers for me.  Also, this is the only Cajun joint that I know of that serves it up this good in AZ (seriously I think you 'Trina refuges need to get to work opening up some more worth while joints)!

Wonderful Food, Wonderful Staff, Great Music Many Nights. A Fantastic Place serving up the best fried catfish and crawfish etoufee you will ever eat in a super friendly setting. Don't miss trying the duck/andouille sausage gumbo. It is phenomenal.

The only reason I may never give this place five stars is that I can't eat anything else but the Pork Chop on the weekends. With all the gravy AND fruit cocktail (hard core ol skool) it is always the perfect bite. I have had the cole slaw, potato salad and red beans & rice and I do recommend those. The cole slaw is very green olive so be warned.

Live down the street and love great Cajun food. They serve authentic plates. We have had the gumbo and étouffée. Both are incredible! Prices are reasonable and worth the quality. Definitely recommended.

Haven t had Cajun and was craving, used to go to the one in SCottsdale all the time, but that cute place closed, so we went to the one in Town and Country mall, that place is not at all attractive to look at, but everytime we go we have great servers, great martinis, and the food is as close as we can get to cajun in Phx, we re always surprised at how slow it is when we go, considering the food is that good, its definately a fun eating experience,

This place had a good vibe and pretty interesting entertainment with a musician freestyling to popular songs. My girlfriend and I had a good experience overall with quality and service. We ordered the cajun combination and the cornish game hen. The house salad was not too appetizing but when is a house salad really going to impress anyone anyway. The cornish game hen and the crawfish etoufee were really good. The only downside is that the chicken gumbo wasn't that great and most of the dishes were on the salty side. That's the only downsides. If I ever were to come again I would totally get the crawfish etoufee.

We enjoyed our experience here. Their are so much options from their menu. Their Catfish Po boy was so delightful. The ambiance was so great and really alive. I love the music and well lighted. Definitely be back!
Food is amazing, great service. Only not 5 stars cuz it needs something to pump up the atmosphere a bit.

my review is already biased from the start.  i've tried cajun cuisine about 3 times now and i'm not a huge fan.  i don't mind eating food with seasoning and some pepper.  but i don't like eating fire sauce in any of my food.  lol.

well, i ordered the lunch special which was some type of chowder with jambalaya on the side.  the jambalaya was way too hot for my taste buds.  i was on fire.   and the chowder was just okay.

the service was good but the food experience was just okay.  i really can't give the food a bad review because cajun is just not my cup of tea.

Fantastic Cajun cooking.   Never been disappointed in catfish which is rare to get anywhere else.  Good appetizers with frog legs a rarity!  Great service and good selections of the standards in creole and jambalaya.  A unique atmosphere with some cool live music also.  Been there a half dozen times in the last year.  Great eats!

Loved the atmosphere, full bar and food was delicious. I had the 1/2 Catfish po boy and cup of shrimp étouffée - AMAZING! My husband had the Chicken Gumbo and he loved it. We also started out with the Boudin Balls for our appetizer. They were so spicy but so good! We couldn't stop ourselves from eating them(came with 3 balls). We loved the musician that was playing the flute, violin and guitar the whole time we were there. Overall, we will be bringing friends and family here in the future! Love it!

Wanted something different for lunch, so I looked up Cajun food and discovered this place. We had a nice comfy booth, and I was very pleased to see they had real sweet tea (I was raised in South Carolina and sometimes miss having it at every restaurant). I had the combo with gumbo, jambalaya and the crawfish etoufee. They were all delicious. I don't care for tomatoes, and I thoroughly enjoyed these because none of them were tomato base. I even had a few leftovers to take home. My boyfriend had their Cajun Burger, which he said was very good, the only complaint being that the menu said it had your choice of cheese as well as some blue cheese crumbles, but the waiter didn't ask and it was served with no cheese. So if you go and order that you might want to ask for the "cheeseburger"? Otherwise all was well, and I was totally digging the blues music.
Tried this place out for the fried catfish and tried the crawfish etouffe.   The food was amazing it was the best catfish I had since moving from Texas!!!!

The service that I received from Kayla is 5 star however everything else was not worth much. If you come by yourself they seat you way in the back behind everyone else where you can't even see the live music (oh the music was good). I kept wishing someone from the big group directly in front of me would go to the bathroom so that I could see. Then the extremely extremely disappointing food. The Gumbo taste okay however it had an odd taste and a bunch of overcooked crawfish that was the best thing that I had and it was not all that great. The barbecue shrimp should be called Worcestershire sauce and overcooked shrimp. All I taste was Worcestshire sauce they should take that trash off of the menu. My garlic bread was burnt, the wings were just ok. The sweet tea was the best thing that I had.

As Cajun Food goes there is none better in the Valley. The food is great traditional New Orleans flavors. Now saying that if you eat at the tourist traps on bourbon street and like their food you will be blown away with Baby Kays. 
Get the Cajun Combo and you wont be disappointed a healthy sample of Gumbo, Etouffee, and Jambalaya. The Rene wings are great if you are looking for something different as wings go. The Smothered Pork Chops are amazing and BBQ Shrimp are great. Lots to choose from and the only Cajun Restaurant in Phoenix that serves real Cajun Food.

Will always be my Go To Cajun place

This is really one of my favorite places to get some good cajun food!  Their fried catfish is nice and crispy, their blackened catfish is juicy and spicy and their red beans and rice are quite tasty.  

Let's talk about their gumbo....hmmm....hmmm... good!  They offer three different types: chicken and sausage, seafood and duck and sausage.  I really love the seafood gumbo, but don't sleep on the duck and sausage.  It has a different flavor, but it's wonderful.  

If you're in Phoenix, you have to try this place.  You'll feel like you're in the Big Easy!!

Average Cajun food, nothing special.  I came here late on a Tuesday night.  Few people there.  It's a dive of a place in a strip mall.  A bluesman was playing nice quiet blues on an electric guitar...very nice.  Kinda scruffy place with all the basic Cajun staples.  Nothing fancy.  Decent brews.  I think the bar tender was waiting tables.  I probably won't be back, but I had heard it was great and wanted to try it.  I think I like more upscale digs and fancier/pricier fare.

Hands down best Cajun food in the Valley. Very authentic, having traveled to New Orleans many times. One thing you have to remember, this is not the gritty Cajun food you may be used to, it is of the more refined higher-quality variety. The food here was created by a native chef from New Orleans and resembles more the high-end style of cooking rather than ordinary street food. If you are not familiar with the higher quality Cajun food, you may be disappointed that it is not what you are used to. For those who can appreciate haute cuisine, this is a must. I highly recommend their Crawfish Étouffée, without peer or equal anywhere in town! A good Étouffée is the true measure of a Cajun restaurant. Also the seafood Gumbo is truly magnificent, light with clarity rather than heavy and thick, it has many layers of flavor. One of the best Gumbos I have ever had. Their signature Cole Slaw is light and refreshing rather than heavy, it includes green olives which give it a unique and distinctive Cajun flare! Overall, great service, highly recommended!
Pretty good place but a lik pricy, so make sure you bring your wallet and your patients because the service is not as prompt as you may like.

This is our families favorite restaurant.  Our kids beg to go here all the time.  We love so many of the items on the menu it is hard to narrow down a favorite.  We usually end up with some of their seafood gumbo.  It is by far the best we have had in the Arizona.  It is very rich and buttery in flavor and the quality of the seafood is very good.  The crawfish etouffee is also to die for.
Delicious po boys and awesome service. glad we moved to this neighborhood. we'll be back

I must first say that I am from cajun country (born and raised in Vermilion Parish, cher). So, I rarely try any "cajun" restaurants outside of south Louisiana. Places like Mimi's are as authentic to me as Taco Bell is to our south of the border friends. 
But, this place is close to hubby's office and I saw something I NEVER see on menus...BOUDIN. This got me excited. If they have boudin, they've got to be legit, right?
The best thing was their crawfish etouffee. Hands down. They do use cream of mushroom soup in it. Depending on the recipe your momma uses, this may be "cheating." But, it was good. 
The shrimp poboy was good. I can't give a place 4 or 5 stars based on a poboy since that's pretty hard to screw up. And, you can get poboys at places like Bubba Gump and Lucille's. 
The gumbo was okay. But, I am biased and rarely like any gumbo as much as my own (even at restaurants back home). 
The boudin was terrible. Seriously, terrible. Even if you've never had real boudin, you won't like this. Maybe it was bad? It had the same flavor as some dressup lipstick I had as a kid. I had to spit it out in my napkin. 

I do like that they fly in crawfish. And, I like the decor. It's simple...just like many of the hole in the wall places I've enjoyed in Louisiana. 
I'd go back for a poboy or etouffee if I was in the area. But, wouldn't make a special trip for it.

Baby Kay's is right in my neighborhood but I just hadn't taken the time to try it - HUGE mistake on my part.  Food was outstanding.  I had the pork chop (strongly recommended by our server) and it was fantastic.  Can't wait to go back to this place.  
PS: I started with a cup of gumbo and I'll get a bowl next time! :-)

Best pork chops I've ever had in my life.
Portions are impressive and the service is very good.
We were there when there was live entertainment, jazz.
Great little place. Wait staff wants to be there.

Fun
Try the pork chops!!
Best cajun in the valley!! Always busy, but for good reason. Also have great drinks for awesome prices!!
This place is amazing! I am soooo glad that I just moved moved down the road. I highly recommend it to anyone and everyone.

The food tastes very good! This was our first time ever eating Cajun food and it did not disappoint. The waiter was very good and took his time explaining the different dishes. The Cajun combo is the way to go, it included a little bit of everything, gumbo, jambalaya, and my favorite: etoufee. Most dishes were available with either seafood or chicken and andouille sausage. We were there on a Saturday late afternoon and there was a gentleman playing live music, he was awesome and it added to the great atmosphere of the restaurant. We will be back for sure!

At first the service was slow they were slammed... I can understand- However once we ordered they were on point. We got the sea food sampler with fried oysters! BOMB! Followed it up with the gumbo and jambalaya combo... both dishes were the perfect balance of flavor and spice.

Great for lunch. The choices are reasonably priced and great bang for your buck. Much better than other similar seafood establishments in the area. Friendly staff and excellent service. All the food is authentic and fresh. Live entertainment at night makes a great night experience. 

Bottom line is the food is fresh and good. You will not be disappointed.

We just moved to the area so we don't know much about anything or where is good to eat. My boyfriend and I were driving around and stumbled across this gem. 
We had Damien as a server who was awesome, attentive and sweet. He was swamped with a lot of tables but we noticed he catered to each one evenly. We had a cup of chicken and sausage gumbo, and crab cakes for an app which were both SO good. And we had the fried seafood baskets too. My boyfriend got the fried oysters which neither of us enjoyed but that's okay. The love music was on point. And everything overall was a good experience. We definitely  be back!

Delicious! The last time we were here, I got the Poboy Sandwich and didn't like it, but this time, I got Fettucine with Vegetables, and I ate every bit of it! My family got Crawfish Étouffée, Baby Kays Sampler, and the Catfish Dinner. All dishes got thumbs up! Thanks for a great Fathers Day dinner!

Ask for Martin! Great service, and he brought carafes with tea to our table so we could keep our glasses filled - a real pet peeve of mine. Btw, I didn't see this on other tables. Martin's the bomb! Lol!

There was this little sandwich shop just around the corner from my office that had the most amazing chicken and sausage gumbo, plus a number of fine sandwiches.  But sadly they shut it down about a month ago and I've been at a loss for a good lunch place ever since.   Besides having some great lunch food, the owners and staff were fantastic and are missed.   HOWEVER, the owners also have another place that is doing great, and its Baby Kay's Cajun Kitchen.   So I drove the 10 minute drive and can't imagine why I waited until now to visit them.   The food was incredible, the menu has many more choices, and a dessert of bread pudding about put me into a food coma!    The gumbo is perfect every time, and the Shrimp Po'Boy was excellent with the horseradish sauce.   And it was sure nice to see both Heidi and Heather again!   
I'll continue to miss their sandwich shop, but I will definitely be making the short drive over to Baby Kay's again.    
Get there a little early, they had a line forming around noon, so lots of other people like the place too!

I love hush puppies and this place has the best hush puppies I've had in a long time! I also had a delicious spinach salad with chicken. 

The staff is nice and the theme is rad. it could make for a super romantic date night, and definitely my new fave night time spot but the lights were on so bright when we went in for dinner. 

The windows are shaded really dark to keep out the Arizona sun's heat which is great, but misleading. We walked in expecting it to be dim mood lighting and jazz music but instead it was really bright and open. Not very private and romantic, which was what i was hoping it would be. Really took from the ambience. Im hoping they set up some mood lighting to go with the jazz theme. :) and maybe a couple booths. 

But that's just how I'd like it, maybe they're going for a dif mood. :)

Either way, get those delicious hush puppies!!
Outstanding service. Scrumptious sea food, lovely music, awesome drinks. Crawfish etouffee is a must try...

For lunch I had the crawfish etouffee and it amazing! The spicy was not too much but just enough. Took a little time to get it but hey for the food I got I completely understand. I'll be back soon for happy hour and some beers.
Authentic Cajun food. Live Music. Family / locally owned. Don't be fooled by the strip mall location, this place is awesome.

Bland, uninspired, boring and dark. Great happy hour spot. Don't miss Spicy Mary. 

--light provided by a cluster of 4 low-watt street-lamp-style globes and candles goes  for a sidewalk cafe, but it was just too dark.
--chicken gumbo uninteresting
--red beans and rice, no flavor
--jumbalaya a mound of bland rice with flecks of meat
--sausage very authentic with ground spicy bits of hooves and snouts, except I can still feel those bits, ew!
--crawdads are the only palatable dish, though it's not far from a Chinese all-you-can-eat buffet. 
--Spicy Mary made with Absolut Peppar and marinated asparagus. Don't miss it. 
--live low slow blues guitar and jazz styles missing the energy I wanted
--food also missing a kind of mischief I expect from this cuisine; I have to douse everything with Tabasco.

Baby kay's is a Phoenix stalward, having survived for at least 15 years, but probably longer. Am Missing something? Is Southern cooking just not interesting? I think not. I'll hav to pull out my old VCR tapes of that heavy French accent narrating Best Chefs of the World.

nothing to rave about this place.
service was poor and the food was bad.
I know, I shouldn't expect much on cajun food in phoenix. but I'm always up for an adventure.

I seriously don't see how this place has received such high ratings...Food was not at all what I was expecting. Husband got the po' boys half w/ gumbo which of course I picked at..not impressed. I had the clam and alligator basket which was overly fried to the max I was munching on basically crisps of what I hoped were the clams. I was expecting maybe Cajun fries? I mean being a Cajun restaurant would seem fitting right? Nope! Regular fat burger fries. We primarily came because we seen the very high reviews everyone gave the establishment for their food. The atmosphere was nice though and the music was good. Staff service was ehhh our server looked bored and he did the bare minimum as our server. I'd probably not come back...

This place was sooooo delicious! I had the shrimp etoufee and catfish platter. My mom had a cup of gumbo and the catfish platter. The catfish were HUGE and fried to perfection. The shrimp etoufee was delicious and had nice, big whole shrimps. The gumbo was great! It had big pieces of spicy sausage and chicken. I'm definitely going back here

If you like live music and cajun food, Baby Kay's is for you.  Bae ordered the cajun burger and said it is one of the best burgers he's had.  I tried it as well and it was tasty (they mix Andouille sausage with their ground beef).  I order the jambalaya and it was very good.  I like dipping the meat in the crawfish sauce.  Speaking of, Bae ordered a side of crawfish with the sauce.  He wanted to try the etouffee since we had an amazing one in Huntsville, we were hoping to find a good local dish.  The waiter suggested the side which is essentially the etouffee minus the rice.  It was good, more seafoody than the Huntsville version.  Neither of us are big on seafood but it was still good.  Overall, Baby Kay's had a cute (but wide open and well-lit) atmosphere with great music and good food.  Would recommend to anyone looking for some genuine cajun food here in the southwest.

I was born and raised in New Orleans and I have to say, the food here is the most authentic I've had anywhere outside of Louisiana. It was my first time here and I chose to try the Red Beans and Rice with sausage. It was like being home with every bite. I definitely recommend going here if you're from the South and are craving a bit of home sweet home. I can't wait to try all of the other items on their menu! I'll definitely be back soon!

This is my favorite restaurant!!  The food is amazing, the service is wonderful....A++!
Try the Crawfish Étouffée and their green olive cole slaw!  Yummy!
Only wish you were still open in the uptown Phoenix area so I could go there for lunch!

Baby Kay's Cajun Kitchen
2051 S Dobson Rd
Mesa, AZ 85202

I had not eaten at Baby Kay's since it was located at Town and Country Shopping Center a long time ago. It was time for a new review.

Companion and I arrived at lunch time and were seated immediately. Our waitress took our orders for drinks and provided the requisite menu's for us to peruse. Most of the food on the menu appeared to be authentic Nola, at least if the taste held up to the descriptions. 

Companion wasn't up on Cajun food, and asked if she could sample one or two things she was considering. Because heat from spice was not something companion enjoyed, she wanted to make sure she would be able to eat what she ordered. Our waitress promptly brought out 3 small cups with etouffee, jambalaya, and swamp water (gumbo for you northerners). Companion tasted all 3 and decided on the etouffee. I couldn't resist tasting them also. The jambalaya had some nice heat but no tomato in it, and the gumbo was true to tradition.

We each started with a cup of etouffee. We were brought plates with some excellent garlic bread on it along with a small bowl of the etouffee. Adding a bit of hot sauce to it and I was in New Orleans! A wonderful broth loaded with crawfish tails with a nice ball of white rice in the center. Companion ate her bowl without hot sauce and fell in love with it. This was the start of a wonderful lunch.

I got the combination basket which had fried shrimp and fried oysters in it along with the most unusual cole slaw I have ever eaten. There is no doubt in my mind that the chef who prepared this basket really knew what he was doing, as the shrimp and oysters were cooked to perfection. Companion had never eaten fried oysters before, and after one taste pronounced them delicious and decided to help me eat mine! The word thief comes to mind. The breading was perfect, and the oysters were a nice size and perfectly creamy. The shrimp, which most places overcook until they resemble something made from butyl rubber, were beautifully prepared, and were delicately tender. As for the cole slaw, what made it so unique is that it is prepared using green olives as one of the seasonings. It was highly unusual, and I still haven't made up my mind whether I like it or not. I'll probably have to go back a few more times to sample it some more.

We finished off lunch with their bread pudding in a puddle of whisky sauce. The bread pudding was dense, covered in pecans, and had coconut in it. I was so full that I could only eat a small amount of it, and companion asked for a box to take it in.

There was only one downer for the lunch, and that was a Sazerac that was ordered from the bar. Unfortunately, it just didn't make the grade and had to be sent back. My understanding is that they used to have a bartender that made a terrific one, and when she left they stopped making the drink. I'm hoping in the future they get a bartender that can make a proper Sazerac cocktail.

The place was clean, airy, with excellent service. Those who wish to can eat outside. Each table had a selection of hot sauces, mostly from Tabasco. I would suggest that they have some Louisiana Hot Sauce available also, as it has a totally different flavor than Tabasco. 

For those who might be inclined to say that this is an expensive place to eat, may I remind them that this is the desert and sea food has to be brought in and is also costly. It all adds up in the end.

4 Stars

I used to make special trips to Town & Country Square-Biltmore to eat at Baby Kay's.  I was crushed when they disappeared.

OH MY ELATION!!  When I passed by on Dobson.  I Love their Gumbo!  I've had lots of their other dishes which are great as well.  I Love Their Gumbo!  Friendly Service.  And did I tell you, I Love Their Gumbo!

We love Baby Kay's! My husband and I have been fans for over 25 years. Their Chicken Gumbo is to die for!
We were there last Saturday night, bit of a drive for us & we were so excited to be there but we were so disappointed in the ambiance. They had KSLX blasting, really?! I love rock n roll but there were commercials more than music on that station. And it's surprising they don't have Pandora or something. We asked them to turn it down especially so we could hear the live entertainment, but they didn't. The first waitress that seated us made a passive aggressive comment to us when we asked for a certain table rather than her first choice. The bright light was our new waiter started his shift with us as one of his tables. I forgot his name but he's new there. Great service and nice personality. We will go back, of course!

Cajun delicious.  
Enjoyed shrimp etoiffe seafood gumbo and chicken and sausage jambalaya. 

All was prepared well from recipes from original owner Kay. 

Wonderful service. 

Had crab cake. Would not recommend. 

I would recommend and will be back.

The étouffée was really good as was the gumbo. Their wings weren't bad either. Only the Jambalaya was off. Too much black pepper. Not much in the way of ambience and its tucked away in a larger shopping center next to Trader Joes. I would come back again and have more étouffée...it is my favorite Cajun dish...

If you're a purest when it comes to Cajun food, then this is the place. The atmosphere compliments the authentic food and service was acceptable. I have made this my go-to spot whenever I crave Louisiana Cajun style cuisine.

Came here with a restaurant.com coupon, so worth it!We started off with delicious barbecue sliders, I had the Cajun combination of chicken jambalaya, chicken and sausage gumbo and an AMAZING crawfish andouille. My boyfriend tried the catfish po-boy and we finished it off with a bourbon sundae. The food was delicious, the service was great and they had decent live music. I will be going back soon!

Great service. Forgot the name of the guy that served us. Food was exceptionally good. Never had tried gumbo but had it this Saturday 3/11 for the first time and it was delicious. Great vibe with a great performer. Felt like I was in The south. I would definitely be back on my next trip to AZ.

service is erratic and rice is dense. expect at least 6 quirky service incidents, including temporarily stealing your credit card. make sure you call if you are running late from your reservation time or they will get testy. dude on violin adds to the charm of the sausage.

I'm not a NOLA native,  but my father is, and mother lived there for 8 years. My father moved back to NOLA in 2010 and I've been to visit maybe once or twice a year ever since. Each time I return home, I yearn for the food back in NOLA. Enter Baby Kay's- The best you're gonna get in AZ. Not everything is perfect, but the service is on point (Kyle was attentive and friendly) and the food and atmosphere brings me to the place I want to be. Very worth it!

Oh baby! This place is great. We ordered our fried turkey from here and it was delicious. We were slightly nervous that the turkey might be drying but it was very moist/flavorful. My thanksgiving dinner was a hit. Definitely recommend this. 

I've also dined here as well. I've had their étouffée and the shrimp po boy. Yummy!! Uh to die for! 

I'll be returning for sure!

Excellent Food! The shrimp etouffee was delicious, the green olive coleslaw was tasty, the garlic bread was fresh and hot, the catfish was quite possibly the best I ever had and the homemade bread pudding with whiskey sauce and pecans... just stunning. We asked for extra lemon and bread and they were there in less than a minute. 

This restaurant is a delight and one of my new favorites. I've been to New Orleans a number of times and this cajun restaurant met my expectations.

Only complaint is $2.40 for a soda.

Came in and got the shrimp etouffee & jambalaya combo. The etouffee has such a great flavor! I've been craving it ever since. It is Creamy and has a mild kick to it. If you aren't a veggie person you'll probably leave a lot behind (I did). But I think I'll still order it next time and get the bigger one so I can have my fill! The jambalaya was good. It was a drier version and kind of reminded me of some kind of creole fried rice. I enjoyed both but definitely recommend the etouffee!

Laissez les bon temps rouler at Baby Kay's! I love cajun/Louisiana style cuisine and was excited to try out this restaurant based on the good reviews and close proximity to my house. The last time I had eaten Cajun food at a restaurant was actually in New Orleans. :) We ordered some hush puppies, boudin balls, I had the Cajun combination and shared some bread pudding.

The hush puppies and boudin balls were perfectly crispy on the outside, with tender filling. I loved the boudin balls. They tasted exactly like those I had in New Orleans. The Cajun combination was a great way to taste all the typical Louisiana style dishes. The crawfish etouffee was my favorite of the three bowls. The jambalaya was interesting in that it wasn't tomato based, so for me it tasted more like a Cajun spiced fried rice. Quite honestly I've had so many different versions of this dish (With a few that I've tried in Louisiana) it's still hard for me to say what a typical jambalaya is supposed to taste like. It tasted decent, but the rice was very slightly undercooked and thus very slightly crunchy tasting. I had the chicken and sausage gumbo which was flavorful and filled with meat and veggies. I tried my friend's seafood gumbo which was by far superior due to the smoky, intense flavor from the dark roux. I also loved the complimentary garlic bread which was buttery, garlicky, toasty heaven.

The bread pudding was a sizable chunk and came with a bowl of whiskey sauce (We asked for it on the side). It was thick, dense, and filled with a ton of ingredients such as nuts and shredded coconut. The sauce was very light and tasted more like very lightly sweet, watery whiskey.

Service was good and our drinks were filled as needed. Our waitress had the foresight to ask if we wanted separate checks or one single bill since we were a party of 6 which I appreciated. 

We went here on a Friday night and they had a musician singing and playing music, which might be a draw for some, but not so much if you are looking for more of a quiet environment where you can chat with friends. Good performance nonetheless by the musician.

I'll definitely come here if I'm craving Cajun style food for that lovely etouffee and seafood gumbo.
Tried Jambalaya,  Ettuffe,  Gunbo, and red beans n rice.   Truly a taste of New Orleans here.  Loved everything.

Wow, this place is a hidden gem! This is the real deal Cajun. We had the Cajun Combo and the catfish dinner and both were amazing. It's all spicy, but just the right amount to enhance the flavors. Our server was great and brought us a tasting of the jambalaya, gumbo and étouffée to make sure we loved it. Overall great experience and they just gained two regulars!
The best Cajun food in Arizona. My favorite is the crawfish étouffée. No other place make it better than Baby Kay's.

Went to Baby Kay's on a Friday evening. There was a 30 minute wait.

We ordered some hushpuppies for an appetizer. My wife ordered a 1/2 Oyster po-boy and gumbo and I orders the shrimp basket.

The hushpuppies came out with a horseradish sauce and ketchup. The hushpuppies were ok, kind of like Long John Silver's hushpuiies. The horseradish sause was excellent though.

The service this night was not very good. We waited almost 1 1/2 hours to get our entrees. The server steered clear of us most of the night, which made us angrier. If she would have communicated and offered a salad or something to tide us over, we would have understood.

We finally get our food and it is average at best. My wife's po-boy and gumbo were cold. My shrimp basket had 8 measly shrimp on it. We were really hoping for better, especially after the wait.

After our experience, we don't know how this place gets such good reviews.. food and service not good.
Best Cajun food this side of New Orleans!  Rivals even Bourbon Street. I'll definitely be going back.

Been coming over 8 years! Never disappointing! Love the staff! Love the Serena Combo!!!!!!
Always a comfort to come here and you have to have the Bourbon Sundae!!!!
We love this place. Great food and friendly atmosphere. If you like southern cooking this place will hit the spot!

Great place, great food, great staff.
I just had a chicken salad but my husband had the Jambalaya, he said it was the best he had ever had.Had the bread pouding for dessert..fantastic! We wil certainly return.

Fair at best. I keep wishing for a great Creol/Cajun place here in town, but, sadly, have yet to find one that is good. 

The food lacked flavor and just was sort of eh. They need a recipe total overhaul/revamp and they'd be fine.
lulu wings were delicious. i had the catfish dinner with shrimp etouffee. delicious !!! loved the live music . wonderful place to enjoy a great meal.

We've made this place a regular monthly stop in for dinner. Service is great, excellent cajun food. We have given up going to Pappadeaux. We prefer sitting at the bar on Friday nights and always get great service. Love their seafood gumbo and ettoufe. The cajun vinagrette dressing they serve is a special favorite of mine. I wish I could buy a bottle! Only disappointment is they are not open on Sundays.

Had an itch for Jambalaya and based on reviews this was the place for it. 
Service and environment were ok, nothing special but also not bad. 
We ended up ordering seafood Gumbo (crab, crawfish, shrimp) & crawfish étouffée. 
Both were very very fishy. I had a hard time eating the Gumbo and only had a taste of the étouffée. I basically had to gag it down. Luckily it was served with garlic bread that was really good, and it helped the gumbo go down. 
I will not be  returning nor will I recommend this place.
The jambalaya and seafood gumbo were excellent, and the prices were very reasonable.
Amazing dining experience! Great food and service! Had the gumbo and catfish with the  ettoufee!

Awesome food, good service, perfect amount of heat. Seafood Gumbo and the shrimp and catfish po boy was to die for. I also liked that I was curious about several items on the menu and the server even offered to give me a sample. One of which was the etoufee that alone will make me come back next time to try that.

Omg, I am in Cajun heaven. So how did I end up her...well, I've passed by this place several time. It used to be called Cajun Kitchen. One day I stopped in after I was craving some good Cajun food and the place was shut down. Well my craving came back and noticed this Cajun place was back in the same spot but under a different name. Shout out to Kate M.!! I read her review and I was salivating of all the nice things she had to say about this place and the photos she posted so I had to give it a try. 

When we first walked in I noticed the music they were placing and it definitely gave it a Louisiana feel. The place isn't very big but comfortably spaced so you don't feel like you will smack the person behind you if you turn around too quick. We were immediately greeted by hostess who seated us in a nice location so that we could get a good view of the rest of the place since this was my first time here. We ordered cup of chicken gumbo as I was so eager to satisfy my Cajun craving.  Didn't take too long and the food came with a side of their succulent garlic bread. Gumbo was super good and I wish I would have ordered the bowl but I didn't want to get too full because there were so many other things I wanted to try. I ended up ordering the shrimp etouffee which was good but it had an overwhelming amount of onions. I can definitely say I will be back to try other things on the menu but gumbo is a must. 

Great fast service and great place for Cajun food.

New (second or temporary location) for this Cajun restaurant. Came to Mesa to try it out, we ordered the catfish dinner with crawfish sauce and a half poboy & cup of seafood gumbo. (All seafood due to Ash Wednesday, wish I made it here last night )  The crawfish étouffée atop the catfish was amazing, perfect texture and flavor, I then took a bite, crispy and spicy on the outside, moist and delicious on the inside.  I don't think i have had better (except blackened, blackened is better heh) .  The gumbo was great as well, the right amount of spice, i was so missing the andouille sausage, but lent.

We showed up on a Friday evening just before it got really busy. Our server was extremely friendly and even brought us a sample of the Cajun Combination which I ordered. It was delicious! I highly recommend this place for great Cajun food and a lovely atmosphere.

Yo this place was LIT ya'll. I literally felt like I was on Bourbon Street in NOLA. The food here tastes very similar to what is found in NOLA and they kept the entire menu creole/Cajun. They didn't try to put a southwest spin on the flavor. I got the fried catfish and got the wings are appetizers. The service isn't bad either but its almost like a tv series. It starts off slow but then it takes off. The best part was the live music played by someone who know how to play an electric guitar and blues music.

I don't know why it took me so long to come here. They have been here for decades. My experience was really awesome. The food was delicious. 
There was this older gentleman on the stage singing great tunes. Nice touch.
It was my first time here and the server caught on to that and told me she would bring me samples of (3things) which i thought was awesome. From that i was able to decide what to order.
I will definitely be back

This is where you want to be for authentic Cajun food and great atmosphere all while feeling like you're getting your money's worth when the check comes. 

Growing up in Louisiana, I was spoiled with great cooking. I always leave disappointed from places like Pappadeaux's. Way too much money for too little spice and too many tables crammed together.

Baby Kay's feels like home. The ambience and food are spot on. More than worth the price.

We loved this place! We assumed it was going to be busy on a Saturday evening so we called in a reservation. However, although they had a steady business, it was not crowded at all...which is a darn shame! 

 I ordered the cajun combination which has gumbo, jambalaya, and crawfish etouffee. It was amazing!!! Fresh, tasty, with just the right amount of cajun kick.  Our server was great (thank you Leslie) and service was very fast! 

There was a gentleman in the corner playing blues guitar which added to the relaxed atmosphere. We have nothing bad to say about Baby Kay's. We recommend it to everyone and we will be back!

This place is pretty cool!  I had no idea this hidden gem was tucked away in a strip mall!  My friends and I opted for outdoor patio seating since it was such a nice evening out.  I recommend taking that route whenever possible.

The food was great!  My friends and I opted for the sampler appetizer and a combo platter and the shrimp special for dinner.  DO NOT leave without having some sweet potato pie!  Everything tasted great!  I'd love to see some different wines on their menu - maybe a good Australian Sauv Blanc or some good white blends to pair with the spiciness of the food but the Melbec that we had was just fine.

And I was impressed that one of the OWNERS was in the trenches working with the staff!  I forgot to mention my check-in deal when the check arrived but that's totally my fault.  I told the owner in the beginning of the meal and said I'd show her again when the check came.   Don't do that.

I will definitely return - most likely with my Dad, he would like a place with such authentic Cajun food!

While Baby Kays's seems like a misplacement in the valley, the food takes me back to my favorite New Orleans memories.  The plates are large and so are the flavors but you will not walk out disappointed. I loved the confluence of local Mexican art in creole culture and I have yet to buy some art to put on my walls at home.  Overall a solid 5. I would definitely go back in the future.

As a native of New Orleans, LA, born and raised in Uptown, this place right here is THE real deal. I ordered food here today for my fiancé and I, and the food was spectacular. 

We ordered the Cajun combo, two catfish poboys dressed, and bread pudding. 
First, the Cajun combo: we substituted the gumbo for red beans and rice, and had the crawfish étouffée and jambalaya. ALL VERY GOOD! I felt like I was eating good home cooked food.

Next the catfish poboys: these were great, really enjoyed mine. The cheese was different than what I'm used to having on a poboy, but it was still good none the less.

Last, the bread pudding: loved it. Bread pudding is my favorite dessert- hands down. The whiskey sauce for the bread pudding came on the side; however, I opted to forgo putting it on the dessert because I don't like whiskey (and it had a strong whiskey taste), and the bread pudding was amazing without it! 

Overall, the service was good, the lady at the bar was very friendly, the atmosphere felt like I was somewhere relaxing on magazine street- I felt like I was back in my hometown. 
I can definitely say any feelings of being homesick, disappeared once I walked inside Baby Kay's, so I'll definitely be ordering from here/ dining here again, and I'll be recommending it to other people.

Stopped in here with the wife for lunch. The food here is fantastic! I had the sampler, and all three items were outstanding, especially the Seafood Etoufee! Heaven in a bowl! My wife had the "Seafood Burger" which is basically a crabcake sandwich. It was delicious and the crabcake was really a good size! no skimping on the portions here. We both left feeling quite full, and thought the price was very reasonable for the quality and portion sizes. Also try the Abita Turbo Dog beer. Dark and nutty. Holds up well to the spiciness of the food.
The only thing I felt was lacking was the music. They had regular light rock playing at a nice sound level, but I think the should have had some Zydeco and Jazz playing to add a little New Orleans flair.
Overall a great place for lunch. Can't wait to try it for dinner!
We dined here as part of a large party and had buffet style price fixed option.  Food was terrible and not anything resembling Cajun.  I would not return if they were giviing it away for free.
Great food, good atmosphere, friendly staff. I had the Shrimp Po' Boy, and it was terrific. The prices were good for the amount of food you get.
I literally felt like I was in New Orleans! The alligator/clam basket was the best! I'm glad I found this hidden gem in Mesa, AZ. Will definitely be coming back for sure. Thank y'all!
This restaurant has amazing food wonderful specials and I'm here on Election night and they actually give a discount because I voted

First but not last time at Baby Kay's enjoying great Cajun food. Had the wings followed by catfish covered in crawfish Étouffée, garlic bread, and jambalaya all while listening to a live soul-blues musician. Ambiance was way more quaint and personal than I expected from a strip mall location. Kyle our server made excellent recommendations and remained attentive without being overbearing. Can't wait for the craw-fish to come in or Thursday chicken fry.

I have been coming here for years...through all the owners.  Always great food and the service is consistently good.  One of my top 5 places to eat in Phoenix.  Twin sisters own the place now and they know how to run a restaurant.

"Baby, how it eat?" GOOD. DELICIOUS. I'm Nola blood and it is very hard to find a meal that taste like a New Orleans native cooked it! Eating anywhere is Arizona, or anywhere outside of New Orleans for that matter, I don't expect much. I usually expect for something to be called one thing but be another (like in flagstaff I got a "crab cake poboy" but it came on a brioche bun! What the heck!!). Here at Baby Kay's, I got crawfish étouffée and a shrimp poboy. Baby, it taste just like home! I was in shock and wished I didn't order half orders. Best creole food in AZ hands down.  two thumbs up from me!!

The ambiance was nice with live music. The decorations were reminisince of a party city Mardi Gras but some of it works. Didn't order any drinks, but the bar had a nice atmosphere. 
Tonight we ordered the Cajun combination and the Cornish game hen. We got the duck and saugage gumbo which was too salty and had a definite kick. The jambalaya was different without the tomato base, but the chicken and sausage added great flavor to the rice. The crawfish etoufee was on point! There was plenty of crawfish and the flavor was remincince of a clam chowder. The Cornish game hen was fried nicely with crispy skin, but overly salty at some points if you got too much skin.

This place is too delicious!!!!

I've been here twice, and I get the three combo plate that comes with the ettouffe, jumbalaya, sausage gumbo or seafood gumbo and potato salad. I love the ettouffe, it's the reason I come here, and the jumbalaya. Everything was just really fantastic, the food and the service!

I'm always thrilled with the experience of checking out different Cajun restaurants. It always makes for a good time, because it's a great excuse to assemble a group and multiple drinks with dinner are de rigeur. My experience at Baby Kay's was just such an occasion, as I joined friends for Cajun food and crawfish (served on Wednesdays at Baby K's).

The overall experience was wonderful. Abita beers on tap, good variety of choices on the menu. Having lived in Louisiana for seven years (although in the notoriously non-Cajun predominantly Scotch-Irish region known as Shreveport), I got to ply my expertise and educate my friends on what they were stuffing down their collective gullet.

The crawfish here were disappointing. I don't know if it was because they were boiled forever or not kept alive before boiling, but the tail meat on many of them were mushy. And the shells were hard to shuck since they were so flimsy. Something was amiss. The novelty value was there, but they were actually pretty unpalatable. I did get a thrill out of discovering deep-fried boudin (pronounced "boo-dan") balls, which were tasty, even though the portion was somewhat meager. I shared this pork-and-liver-and-rice specialty with my friends who promptly uttered yummy sounds.

A good time was had by all. Service was friendly and attentive, but in my opinion, the food was a bit overpriced. I give them props for providing a decent Cajun dining experience, but the menu could use a little tweaking and they need to bring up their crawfish game. I'll be back for the ambience and appetizers sometime, just to relive a little Louisiana experience, and maybe suck down a few Turbo Dogs (that's my Abita beer of choice).

Delicious and large portions.   I had the dirty rice and crawfish etouffee.  My husband had the catfish and my daughter had the jambalaya.  None of us could finish our dinners but they were all excellent.

I agree with the other reviewer's about Baby Kay's.  It's good, but it's not outstanding.  I think it's a fun place to come when you're tired of the standard Italian or Mexican, and I've always had great service here- so no complaints there.

I've tried the hush puppies, spinach and artichoke dip, and the Louisiana crab cakes for appetizers- all pretty good.  And for the main dish, I've had the vegetarian etouffee, catfish and the catfish po-boy.  The entre's are pretty big because they come with garlic bread, a baked potato and salad if my memory has held up.

If you've never tried this place, I recommend going and seeing what you think.  The food is tasty enough and it's a fun spot.  They have live jazz music on the weekends too! Check it out!
Fantastic place to grab some tasty jambalaya, étouffée, and gumbo.  Service was great and the food came out quick.  Expect to pay around 20 bucks for a meal, but well worth it in my opinion.

Awesome food, great service even on a busy Saturday night. We had the Shrimp Etoufee & Red Beans & Rice. Try the green olive Cole slaw - it will make you crave more. Can't wait to go back to try something else!
What a nice surprise!  Enjoyed the food. Great service and cool ambience  little one man sax  playing. Great date night!

I love coming here for lunch. Dinner is great also, I just live to far away.

Been coming here since 1994!

I lunch here once a week usually.

I have to drive in from Maricopa now!

Seafood etoufee was good.  Guitar player was fantastic.  Waitress was very nice and helpful.  Service was good.

The Jambalaya and gumbo were ok.  Fried oysters were ok.  The potato salad was ok.  The atmosphere was ok.

All in all, an ok Cajun dining experience.  I'd use more adjectives but they didn't really spring to mind or tongue.  It didn't knock my socks off but it did scratch the itch.

This is the closest thing to NOLA you will find in this city.

Everything they serve is good, the catfish, the etoufee, gumbo, jambalaya, you name it.

The lunch specials are fantastic, try the seafood enchiladas on Tuesday.

I can't believe I'm going to post this here because I don't like competition when it comes ot getting my order (they run out), but they have a crawfish boil on Wednesday night, it is AWESOME.

I have friends who are from LA and they swear by this place.  I am new but a dedicated fan.

If you don't like this place, you probably don't like this kind of food or you are just a weirdo.  Anyone who gave it less than 4 stars must be from the 70s because they are on ludes.

Wow! I'm no expert in Cajun cuisine but this place is great. We got the sampler seafood app and shared the combo plate that came with jambalaya, gumbo and seafood étouffée and homemade coleslaw on the side.  All was great but the étouffée was delish! Creamy with excellent hints of spices and chunks of shrimp, catfish, etc. 

We will definitely come back again and try out the rest of the menu. 

Staff is friendly and service was fast.

I'm so glad I gave baby Kay's a chance. I am from Louisiana and I am usually highly critical of Cajun/creole cooking. I was pleasantly surprised. The hush puppies were delish, not greasy at all. The etouffee was very well seasoned and the lulu  LuLu wings are a winner for sure. I am going to be heading back on one of the live music nights so I can get the full experience.

We stumbled in here by accident, but as Bob Ross says, "there are no mistakes, only happy little accidents". I haven't had much experience other then the occasionally taste testing of a friend's jambalaya, but I throughly enjoyed this place. 

I ordered the Fettuccine Alfredo (lol not very Cajun-y) but it had a little "Cajun kick" to it. It was a huge bowl for only $10~ and I definitely had enough for leftovers. It was a tad spicy  and it was delicious!

Friends got the gumbo and jambalaya combos and they loved there food as well. 
Bonus: they have our complimentary garlic bread!

If you want good Cajun food come to Baby Kays. I have been here multiple times, and enjoyed every meal from them. 
Lulus wings
Hush Puppies
Crab cakes
Boudin Balls
Gumbo (chicken & seafood)
Catfish PoBoy
Crawfish Etouffee
We highly recommend Baby Kays
Service and food were exceptional. Brought my foodie friends from Virginia and they were in heaven. Always love coming here for great food and friendly efficient service b
Really enjoyed the Cajun food. If you're looking for an authentic place this is where you need to go. Even have live music.
Their catfish dinner with crawfish sauce is bomb! But we always come in large parties and that is always a problem for them to handle with the food and bills when we need them split.

By far my favorite  restaurant  in the east valley. Great Cajun cuisine every time! Seafood gumbo is my go to dish of choice. The pork chop Fiday night special is amazing, thick tender and smothered  in brown gravy. The boudin balls with the spicy jelly are a great combo of spice and sweet. Happy hr.  from 4-6 has great affordable snacks . Service is excellent and the weekend blues guitar provides a bit of NO flavor.

Did you know there is live music at Baby Kays? A guy in the corner playing blues guitar. I only just noticed him on my last visit. I've been there a few times in the last few years. I thought it was a CD playing.  I had taken the music for granted without really paying attention to the sounds of fingers scratching across strings, feet tapping on the floor--the other accents that separate real from Memorex..

Maybe that's fitting. I think Baby Kay's has been taken for granted for years now. I remember when it rolled into the valley on a faddish wave of Cajun corn and blackened everything. The endurance of this one place tells you that something about it was more right than the other business that were claimed by time, recessions and the fickleness of the public.

Whatever others might say, I think this place has about the best shrimp etouffe and dirty rice you're going to find in the valley. The central location and laid-back vibe are bonuses.

This place has been around a long time, and I've been there quite a few times. It's hard to find decent Cajun food in Phoenix, but Kay's usually does pretty well.

Our last visit wasn't the greatest. The duck & andouille gumbo was nice, if not quite piping hot. I forgave that, as it's one of the few places around you cna find duck of any kind, or andouille for that matter. The shrimp etouffe came out stone cold, and the waitress quickly returned it to the kitchen where they nuked it to almost hot. Microwaved etouffee just isn't right. 

An order of dirty rice with a side of 2 links of andouille proved almost pointless, as we specifically made clear this was an entree, and expected the 2 links to be cut up and added to the rice. What we got was a small bowl of dirty rice with two tiny breakfast-sized links laid atop it.  

The crab cakes weren't bad, being mostly crab with little bread crumbs, but they really didn't scream authentic cajun cakes to me. Plus, they too were a bit on the cold side - even though everything came out quickly. 

On the plus side, they have Abita beers on tap. Turbo Dog is always welcomed - especially if it's on tap. 

Another plus is you can stop in on a weekend night (we went on a Saturday) even at 9p and they are open. The place was empty barring a few people at the bar. That should be your clue. 

My previous experiences here were all around lunchtime, with no problems as far as food temp, so I suspect that late night diners are getting food that has been sitting around in a steamer all day long. 

Regardless, I am only giving this 2 stars. Your mileage may vary.

Having recently relocated from the North Valley to Fountain Hills, we had to find some new places to eat! We were introduced to Baby Kay's by good friends a few months ago and we just can't get enough!!

Our journey began with the Boudin Balls - amazing sausage croquette style appetizers with HEATED apricot jam. WOW! The jam itself is something I had to get the recipe for! The cup of Seafood Gumbo was large enough for me to split with my hubby - and the flavors were amazing! Crawfish Etouffee was a great base for the fried shrimp dinner! 
Hubby ordered the Fried Chicken (Special on Thursdays) and the seasoning was hot and flavorful - crispy as always! I tried a friend's catfish & was pleasantly surprised - since I'm not a fish eater - it was pretty good! 
Dessert - well that HUGE Chocolate Bourbon Sundae was shared by all 4 of us!

Before I finish I MUST mention the drinks! Try one of the house specials - they hit a home run with them every time! Bring s designated driver - because they pack a PUNCH! 
A special p.s. to our waiter most nights - Martine' (pronounced Marteeen) BEST SERVICE EVER!! Consistent quality, service and so far not one bad experience. Need I say the place is spotless, funky, jazzy in a New Orleans way - OK I just did! BonAppetite!! Our FAVORITE PLACE ! Worth the drive!

This past weekend while the family was at Spring Training,our son talked us out of going to our spot going to our they we frequent in Arizona. And the family were glad he did. The food and environment was great. Our server suggested the wings as a appetizer and it was a tasty suggestion. Every one enjoyed their dish. And we can wait to go back when we are in the area.

Ate dinner here with the family tonight. WOW! Everything was amazing! We started with the sampler, it had catfish shrimp fried oysters qnd jalapeño poppers, yum. The star of the night was the crawfish etouffee...AMAZEBALLS! Some of the best I have ever had, and yes that includes New Orleans. Also tried the fried catfish with crawfish sauce and again, Amazing!  Sorry for sounding all excited but it has been so long since I've had great cajun food. Only down side was service was a little slow, but it was a Friday so that is understandable. Will definitely be back

I have been there twice and enjoyed the food both times. First time there I had the Shrimp Boil. VERY Cajun (spicy) but very good. Second visit I had the Crawfish Boil which was excellent. The other person in my party had the Crawfish Etoufee which he said was very good. The service is a little slow but all the wait staff is very friendly.
Outstanding seafood gumbo and green olive coleslaw. Have had the seafood enchiladas as well.. excellent cajun choice.

I used to go to the old location where they had a rockin etouffee. 
Unfortunately, I either walked into the wrong place or they are not making the same quality stuff anymore. 
The "étouffée" I ordered was very much like a watered-down version of the filling in a Stouffers chicken pot pie - no pepper or spice of any kind and certainly no roux.  Then there were like 6-7 really puny shrimp buried in this mysterious liquid and the whole thing had this nasty old restaurant smell. It seemed really old. 
I felt really ripped off by the $16.95 price & kept wondering if I had stumbled into an episode of Kitchen Nighmares! 
I hope the rest of their food is better, but I would never go near that pseudo-etoufee again.
So glad a Cajun restaurant opened up in the old location with a much improved quality and menu. Tops for fast Cajun meals.

For a quick lunch I order the half catfish po-boy with a side of potato salad and seafood gumbo. The food was OK, the sandwich was the only thing I finished. The potato salad didn't have much flavor and just tasted bland. 

I thought it was expensive for a lunch meal. I paid $16 total and ordered water because I do not drink soda. I haven't been back because I am a fan of good prices almost everything on the menu was over $11 even for a sandwich.

Unreal Cajun food. Best in town so far, by far.


Service was kinda shitty. Especially considering we went at 2pm and there were like 6 people working.


The food however is off the chains.

Being a Cajun - decided to try out this place and I am so glad I did!  The food is so very spicy and yummy.  If you are a fellow Cajun (or someone who likes good and spicy dishes) I  STRONGLY recommend giving it a try!

The dirty rice and boudin at Baby Kay's are really quite wonderful - a local treasure in Phoenix. Baby Kay's and Papadeaux's take the prize for Cajun restaurants so far in Phoenix, with good food at reasonable prices. The lunch is a little pricier here - and so I recommend Baby Kay's for dinner because it's the same price. But hey if Greekfest across the street is full for lunch, pop over to Baby Kay's. The food is consisistently good - gumbo, jambalaya and oyster po-boy. Highly recommended.

Made my second visit to Baby Kay's. I was just as pleased as the first time.  Tried the lulu wings and they were amazing,  bursting with flavor.  I also got a combo this time trying 3 of the Cajun staples,  jambalaya, etoufee, and gumbo.  I really liked all three and glad they were distinct in their own way.  I like the potato salad more than the coleslaw, I was expecting a more zingy flavor with the green olives.. my boyfriend likes the seafood basket with oysters and catfish. He ordered it again with the dirty rice which was flavorful as well.  

Definitely suggest getting the pain killer, be careful it can be a sneaky one. 

Service was great both times.  The waitress we had last night was vey helpful and patience that goes a long way in my book.  

I guess po' boys will be next and of course an order of lulu wings ( I think I'm hooked)
Great food. We had the Boudin balls, and crab cakes appetizers great and spicy. The fried Cornish game hens were magnificent.

We looked for Gumbo and found this place. Gumbo is awesome! I went there twice in two weeks!! I had Chicken Gumbo (light taste), Sliders and Jambalaya. My boyfriend had Duck & Andouille Sausage Gumbo (thick taste) and 1/2 Po'Boys. Let's soak garlic bread in Gumbo and enjoy them!

So I am heading to NOLA for a vacation next week and no better way to prep for the mouth orgasm I'm about to have then head to Baby Kay's.  For the Phoenix Valley this has to be the best Cajun food around.  

I ordered the Cajun combination which is a cup of each: Seafood Gumbo, Crawfish Etouffee, and sausage jambalaya.  Also on the side you get garlic bread and potato salad.  

The Seafood Gumbo was the only one I didn't enjoy it was just ok nothing like I thought it was going to be.  I should have taken the downgraded chicken gumbo.  

The Crawfish Etouffee was awesome it was the best of the three.  It was full of flavor and just yummy.  I think next time I will order just that alone.  

The Jambalaya was good but after the Etouffee it unfortunately was judged unfairly :).  It did have huge chunks of great sausage and tasted good.  

They tried to sell me on dessert but I was so stuffed I didn't even finish my side of potato salad.  3 cups of food actually is a lot more than it sounds like.  

I will be back for sure as this place is a true gem and they have Abita beer which always scores points in my book.

Best Cajun food in town, plus a full bar and live entertainment on the weekends. Great service too. A bunch of us do lunch every Wednesday and that works out just right, because the Wednesday lunch special is a killer "Bayou Baked Potato" and that, just now, made my mouth water only saying it.

If you've ever been to New Orleans and have therefore been spoiled by actual cajun food, this place is a guaranteed disappointment. My $12 shrimp po'boy had maybe 10 shrimp on it, something that is supposed to be a staple of cajun cuisine. The couple of small pickles, half of a tomato slice and soggy lettuce given as dressings for the sandwich were an embarrassment. I'm not sure what flavor the chips were, because there was no flavor. I think I could have had better at Long John Silver's, and I hate Long John Silver's.

We were able to enjoy  patio seating on a nice spring night here at Baby Kay's.  Tucked into a nice strip mall area near several other restaurants, boutique shops and Trader Joe's it can also make for a fun outing.   The food here was authentic and flavorful.  The food was spicy but not so much as to loose touch with the flavor of it all.  I could have made a meal out of the seafood gumbo alone but got the 2 item that came with red beans and rice ( I barely touched it I was so full).  My friend got a three item combo and while the portions looked meagar, they filled him up and he was quite pleased.  We didn't quite know what to expect with the green olive coleslaw when we saw it as an option but if you are a green olive fan you will enjoy the mix of tart briney sliced green pimento stuffed olives with the slaw.  I would have liked to try the oyster po' boy, I will have to go back just for that and the slaw.
Super yummy !!  Started with étouffée.  Now I try the wings and the barbecue pork sliders.

I was super excited to try out this restaurant because the reviews seem to be very strong but needless to say I was a bit disappointed.  

The service was OK ( our waitress could have been a little bit more personable) . She did her job but definitely was not as welcoming or outgoing as I was expecting 

The  food was not as good as I was hoping for after reading the reviews  ( the garlic bread served with our appetizer and meal was definitely old and stale  ( I swear it must have been frozen and microwaved ) . I did like the crawfish étouffée but felt like the gumbo was very watery and the jambalaya I ordered was mainly white rice .... All in all - I felt my experience and  the food was not as outstanding as i had hoped.

My hubby and I love Cajun food, especially Etouffee. We have been going to another Cajun restaurant for our etouffee fix for years and since we moved to Mesa we decided to give this a try.
First of all, they have a great happy hour specials. We ordered the crawfish etouffe and the fried shrimp appetizer from the menu. WOW WOW!! We truly did enjoy each of the entrees. There is a reason why this restaurant still attracts great clientele.
We will definitely be coming back for more of our Cajun fix.
Thank you Baby Kay's!

After driving by numerous times we finally stopped in. I got the Cajun combo with etoufee, gumbo, and jambalaya. While all were good, next time I will get the etoufee! It was rich and creamy with just enough spice!

Having lived in Louisiana for two years, overall I wasn't impressed with the food, atmosphere, etc. overall.  Maybe it's in a good location, but it wasn't visible from the road (or not as far as I could see).  The restaurant was randomly decorated with "cajun" propaganda, posters, and articles.  One article on the wall was about New York City and didn't fit in at all.  

My friend and I ordered the house wine and it was decent, but I guess you get what you pay for.  Also, we ordered the spinach-artichoke dip for an appetizer with garlic bread; I can't complain about that dish.  For dinner, I got the Baby Kay's special with red beans and rice and seafood gumbo.  I enjoyed the gumbo because it had crawfish in it and the red beans and rice was okay, too.  I was going to order the crawfish etoufee, but it was $18.25, when the other entree was $11.25, and I had spent a lot on my vacation.  A green olive coleslaw was included with the entree, but it contained a lot of mayo, and I didn't eat any more than one bite.  That was kind of my fault, though, for ordering coleslaw. 

i thought the decor was really dated and the waitress/bussers asked me like five times if I was done with my gumbo, which I was not.  

Good cajun food is hard to find beyond the bayou.

Incredible food, great service, great prices! The side salad was fresh, cold and     a great value.  I had the shrimp etufe and it was amazing. Spices were perfect, portion size was good (having the 2nd half for lunch and it's even better). Drink menu was good- had an Irish Mule- and my husband had a Hurricane. Only disappointing thing was the bread pudding and mostly because it wasn't what I was expecting. Dense and flavorful but somewhat dry. Will get the bourbon sundae next time. Great experience- I will definitely go back.

I ate here last night with my folks and g/f. Having already read previous yelpers i already knew what to try and what i wanted.

The seafood gumbo was very good as was the chicken and sausage gumbo. I enjoyed a cold Turbodog along with my meal that paired fairly well with the spices from the sausage. My dad was a little disappointed that they were out of oysters for his po'boy but he claimed he was happy with the catfish po'boy in the end. Enoyed the live blues music while dining and having a good time.

All in all expect rather slow service but better than most cajun food in phoenix. Would eat here again in the future.
Authentic Cajun Food!  Who needs fancy when you can get real Gumbo, Jambalaya, Pooh Boys, Etouffee, Andouillee, etc.

I guess if I had never enjoyed GOOD cajun food *cough* Baseline/Price *cough* previously, or never enjoyed it at all, this place would get 3.5 stars, maybe 4, but that world does not exist for me in this current plane of reality.  Really, this is 2.5 stars, but there is no way to give a 1/2 star.

Gumbo was meh.  Decent taste but the rue was not fantastic and frankly kind of oily.  Red Beans and Rice were boooooring and the only thing that saved it was the sausage.  Potato salad was also meh and didn't leave any great impression.  

Price was on par with other cajun spots.  If you think this is excellent cajun food, well, "shame on you".  :D
If you want to experience NOLA (New Orleans Louisiana) then this is your place to go! Nice size portions and yummy alcoholic beverages! The staff are friendly.

The only time I ever had "cajun" food before I went to Baby Kay's last week was when I was at Disneyland...and I was not impressed with Disneyland's version of "cajun" (Sorry, Walt! Love the rest of the place). I went with three friends from work last week, and it was just fabulous all-around. I'm not a big fan of a lot of spice, but Baby Kay's does a good job not completely overwhelming their food with so much spice you can't taste anything but. I had the catfish with court bouillon sauce. The fish was definitely fresh, breaded with something heavenly and light, and you get a filet and a half...of the biggest catfish I've ever seen. There's spice in the breading, but it's SO good...the sauce is nice, too! When you go, you really need a Hurricane...oh, my! And if you like ice cream, go for the bourbon chocolate sundae dessert. I didn't even need the ice cream...the sauce was so good I could have eaten it by itself! Definitely a must-go-to place!
The food was pretty authentic. The gumbo was delicious. The service was really slow as I think it was only 1 server working . He was very polite. Food was good. I would go back.

We went to this place based on reviews. I am highly upset the food and customer service. It took at least 15 minutes to get drinks.  When they brought out my fiance  wings he thought they were the breaded ones (it's our first time there) we were told "well why didn't you order the other ones" I found that so rude and disrespectful.  Horrible customer services.  We askes for the other wings were told they would be brought out.... never where. Our sides were cold and catfish was salty!! Let's not mention they never brought out my fiance poptato salad until I mentioned it when i was paying. I will for sure never go back there, defienty not after the customer service.

We tried the Cajun combo with seafood gumbo, and the Thursday fried chicken special.  This was a TON of food, and everything was delicious.  I don't know much about Cajun food specifically, but I was pleased with my takeout experience.  The woman who took my phone order was also very helpful in finding me good menu options.

Went to Baby Kay's in Mesa on 01/08/2015 with my wife.  The following is what was ordered:

We ordered the following:

1) A Cup of Seafood Gumbo
2) One Cajun Combination (seafood gumbo, jambalaya, and crawfish etoufee)

Most of it was okay, except for the following:

The gumbo was too salty.  My wife even said it was too salty.  Also, the seafood and crawfish did not taste fresh enough.  

Otherwise it was okay.  My wife's comment was, "She has had better Cajun food in Chicago, and elsewhere." 

The food was okay though.
Super delicious crawfish etoufee, jumbalaya and gumbo.

Oyster po'boy, bitches!  Thick, juicy hunks of oyster, lightly battered and fried, then put on a toasted hoagie roll.  Served with homemade potato chips, a pile of sweet pickle slices and a side of the remoulade sauce.  The sauce is what makes it!  It's a horseradish sauce and yummy!  I poured a bit of it over my sandwich.  It's obviously the specialty of the house, because our server asked each of us if we wanted it on the side.
Oysters were big, juicy and firm, not too much so, though.  Nothing like oysters that aren't edible.  I've had them elsewhere and it's really disgusting.
I just burped and it tasted like the po'boy.  All the boys at work are jealous.

I cannot recommend Baby Kay's. I've tried to like it but I am always disappointed by the food, despite others' aplomb. I'm from New Orleans and have dined at the Crescent City's fine Cajun and Creole restaurants, so I know what good Cajun and Creole food is. Unfortunately, Baby Kay's falls short of what good, classic Cajun and Creole food should be.

I feel sad writing this review because I do not want people to be turned away from Cajun and Creole food, but I feel very sad that, for many people, Baby Kay's will be their only taste of the bayou.
I alwaus get the Baby K sampler all and still go home with food. I love the oysters most of all and the food is seasoned well.

This has become one of my favorite local spots. I got take-out here once a year or so ago, but wanting to use our Entertainment book coupons, we came twice recently. We dined in the last two times and really enjoyed our meals. The service is attentive and friendly and the atmosphere is very chill and low-key. Last night (Thursday), there was a blues performer alternating between his violin and guitar. 

I have been to New Orleans many times and having lived in the Florida panhandle, I love, love LOVE, anything with crawfish. Boy, do they do it right with their crawfish etouffee! Fair warning that their food can be spicy but that is typical with that food genre. I have had their seafood gumbo (chunky, spicy goodness), jambalaya, fried catfish, fried shrimp....everything is very good. I particularly love their hushpuppies with the spicy remoulade sauce. You can tell it has a lot of horseradish in it, which I love. 

They also have great mixed drinks (my favorite is the Creamsicle) and they have a good selection of Louisiana beers. I honestly think this restaurant is a great representation of Cajun style food and feel lucky to have it my hood!

I just have to give Baby Kay's more words.  This food is just awesome.  The Étouffée is to die for, you'll be hard pressed to find its equal in New Orleans, and I've tried!  They deliver consistant high quality food, I'm always super impressed with their Lulu wings.  They're breaded, fried and tossed in a fantastic sweet spicy sauce.  The wings themselves are also of high quality, I've never found any place in the valley that serves wings with so much meat on them, they aren't sacrificing quality to provide a reasonable price happy hour here.

I also recommend happy hour for the sampling of so many good things, split a cup of chicken gumbo or a cup of Étouffée and some of the sliders.  Everything is palate pleasing.  Don't forget dessert, get the chocolate bourbon sunday.  And make sure you're splitting it at least 4 ways, its massive and super sweet!

We are also ice tea people, some places get it right and some don't, its the good stuff here.  Doesn't have to be flashy to compliment a good meal!  The staff is also great, they really seem to care and somehow even import a little of that New Orleans charm (if ya know what I mean).

My girlfriend and I were looking for some good gumbo around the valley and found baby Kay's on yelp. It was quite a drive for us coming from the west valley, but totally worth it!
