We had the chicken and sausage gumbo and pork po boy with sweet potato fries. The gumbo was well seasoned and had a great kick to it; both the chicken and sausage were tender. Po boy was delicious and so were the fries. Dessert looked absolutely delicious and massive, but we were way too full after dinner to try some! Will definitely have to save room next time. Portions were decently sized, especially if you're splitting two dishes it's more than enough to leave you feeling full and satisfied. We will be back soon!

I love this little place. Super Friendly staff in a great location. I was even drawn in by the clientele; I encountered several regulars as I waited for my order. All raved about the food and recommended several dishes. Well this was my cheat day and what better food to cheat with...fried. I tried the catfish and shrimp. It was just ok. There wasn't much fish to the fish, more batter. The shrimp was only slightly better. Could have been seasoned a bit better so on my next visit, I'll be trying something different.

This is the go to place. When the group can't decide where to go for lunch this is the one place we can all agree on. Fun friendly service and really good food. Don't miss this if you are near the Biltmore. Make sure you try the green olive slaw!
The crawfish etoufee is unparallel to any I've ever had. I will keep going back as long as they keep serving this dish. The wings are dynamite as well.

Baby Kay's was an experience as much as a wonderful meal. There was live music playing (blues), their decor makes you feel like you're in New Orleans, and there was incredible service. Our waitress was very attentive, kind, and helpful. It was nice because all of the waiting staff helped each other out, so drinks weren't empty for long, and we got our plates bussed as soon as we were done. The food was absolutely delicious: I got the Cajun Combo, but the stand-out there was the Crawfish Etouffe. It had a nice little kick to it. Paired with a New Orleans beer and the complimentary garlic bread, this meal was the epitome of satisfying. Highly recommend this place--I will certainly return soon.

I have been coming here for many many years. The food is always excellent and fresh very authentic cajun. They have 1 of the best crawfish Étouffée that I have ever had including in the new orleans. Friendly's helpful stuff is there to make your meal perfect. Great jumbalaya dirty rice and there garlic bread.

Have not been here in about a year+ because of the move n remove but I must say they are doing the same great quality food service and atmosphere out in Mesa. You have to come out and check this place out for authentic Cajun cuisine. Sooo many awesome dishes to choose from + an incredible happy hour everyday from 3 to 6 and Saturday 2 to 6. One of my favorites for sure is the crawfish etouffee and dirty rice. YUM.
Heidi n Heather are FANTASTIC. 
Come by n check it out for sure.
Not too many places I can get food that taste like home. This place measures up big time.  !!!!

I could have sworn I already wrote a review for Baby Kay's, but I can't find it, and it's not in the filtered reviews, so I have no idea what happened to it.  So here goes again!  I went there for lunch today and had the half shrimp po boy and cup of seafood gumbo.  I was really impressed with the flavors of the seafood gumbo, which had crawfish and shrimp.  Of course it's not as good as homemade gumbo, but it was still pretty good.  And it's pretty hard to mess up a shrimp po boy, but it was served with this really tasty dressing/spread that I used to spread on the inside of the top bun.  All in all, a good lunch meal! 

I would love to go for their crawfish boils on Wednesday nights, but having lived in Dallas for several years, it would be hard for me to rationalize paying $36 for 4lbs of crawfish, ONE piece of corn and ONE potato.  That's just highway robbery.  Anyone who has lived in places where the boiled crawfish options are abundant, knows that $9 per pound is just too expensive.

I'm from Texas, and there's a lot of people from Louisiana who relocate and open up good eats. Therefore, I've had a good amount of delicious Cajun food. I was craving some here in Phoenix, so I thought I'd give Baby Kay's a try.

It's located in a shopping strip with a good amount of parking. The restaurant is big, simple in decor, and there are a couple of servers. I feel like they need at least one more person helping out in the dining room because service was very slow, although when she did stop by our table, she was very good.

We started with the hush puppies, which were a good portion size for the price, but the spices seemed to be lacking. I know hush puppies are usually a simple batter deep fried to perfection, but these were nothing to write home about.

Shrimp etouffee was pretty good. I like that the shrimp were fresh, not frozen, and that there were lots of them. Accompanying rice did not seem fresh, though. Chicken po-boy with BBQ sauce was very boring and not worth the price, but unfortunately that's to be expected of non-seafood dishes in seafood restaurants.

I think the spices were kind of lacking all around, and the service was slow. Prices were kind of high, but at least the seafood is fresh. It wasn't worth the drive for me. Don't think I'll be back.

Came here for the 1st time last weekend with a party of 18 girlfriends and we had a truly fab dinner at Baby Kay's.

Firstly, the staff was wonderful and accommodating- a terrific bunch of people who provided great service to us.

Secondly, the music was great! There was an older gentleman playing some nice grooves on his guitar and we thoroughly enjoyed him!

As for the food? It was really good. I'm not well versed in Cajun food and this was really my first time eating it. I was impressed!

I had a hankering for fish that unfortunately had to go unsatisfied because the only fish they have on the menu here is catfish. Ugh. I am just not a fan of catfish at all! So instead, I ordered the shrimp po'boy sandwich with fries and a side of shrimp etoufee. I didn't eat the "sandwich" portion of the po'boy because they served it plain on a dry hoagie bun with only lettuce and tomato on the side. I'm trying to be "selective" with my carbs and it just wasn't appetizing enough for me to cheat. Instead, I ate the fried shrimp off the bun and found it to be delicious! Well-seasoned and cooked perfectly! The French fries were also very tasty. I hadn't ever eaten etoufee before, but I was pleasantly surprised! It was uniquely flavorful and scrumptious! I would have preferred more finely chopped onions (there were big onion hunks in this stuff), but other than that I really enjoyed it.

If Baby Kay's was closer to my neck of the woods, I'd be more likely to be a repeat customer because there were a lot of things on their menu I'd have loved to try. I'm not in the East Valley much but if I'm ever in the vicinity, Baby Kay's would be high on my list to go again!

My friend and I came here for a birthday dinner. The food and service were both excellent. A Hurricane for a cocktail, the Cajun Sampler, and Bread Pudding with whisky sauce for dessert.

The Hurricane is tasty but not New Orleans potency (a good thing). The food is not cooked super spicy hot but there is a choice of pepper sauces available. Dessert portions were very generous!

I love cajun food. This place is the best I've found in the valley so far! Still not french quarter caliber but hey, we aren't there. 
The flavors were great. The seafood gumbo and the crawfish etouffee was just the thing to give me my fix for that cajun craving! Way less work and mess than a boil like the kind at the Angry Crab. I felt like I got way more crawfish meat in the etouffee. 
My husband got the fried combo basket with catfish, shrimp and clams. Light breading, very good. They know how to cook their shrimp here.
I feel like they could skip the paper doilies though. 
I love that they have vegetarian options too!

I had the gumbo and jambalaya combo and it came with a salad.  The house dressing is very good and there is subtle heat in the gumbo and jambalaya that sneaks up on you.

The fiance had the pulled pork po boy.  That was porky gold!!  Awsome flavor and tender as the day is long.  

Good blues playing in the background make this a cozy place for lunch or dinner.

I was really impressed by the food here! Not only was it delicious, but the portions were very generous. Great salad, crawfish etoufee, jambalaya, dirty rice, alligator, sweet potato fries, and shrimp po' boy. Basically, it was all amazing! Everyone in our party was happy. Also, great service: one of our friend's plates was late to the table, so the server brought her a complimentary salad to munch on while she waited. 

We will definitely be back! Hopefully we will catch some of the life music next time.
Delicious! the pork chop is to die for! definatly a hole in the wall, definatly worth it!
Can't give it 5 stars even with the exceptional food. The Chicken & Sausage gumbo is fantastic but at $1 1.50 a bowl it's quite expensive for what you get. Sorry I can't return

I LOVE THIS PLACE! My husbands family is from Louisiana, so when his uncle told me about this place I jumped at the chance to go. The wait time for a table wasn't bad at all for a Friday night. The food was amazing! We ordered the combo appetizer  but the waiter forgot to put it in. We reminded him and he put it in for us and we got it free. That was fine with us. My sister doesn't like seafood so she had the chicken Alfredo and she said it was very tasty.

We just happened upon this wonderful little place. I believe it's in a newer location and we couldn't be happier. Every plate of food we had was traditional and tasty. The vegetarian etoufee was the biggest surprise with its creamy vegetable sauce over perfectly cooked rice. The jambalaya and gumbo choices were fabulous, especially the duck option. Food is a teeny bit spicy here so be prepared to grab a chilled Abita beer with dinner. Can't wait to get back!

AWESOME Cajun.  
Came in on a Saturday with my husband and sat at the bar to get some Cajun fare.  We got the seafood gumbo and the crab cakes. Both were delish! Shrimp in the soup was plump and juicy.  Sitting at the bar, we talked to the tender and the guests.  Everybody was friendly and the tender even was calling us by name when we left.  She made us great hurricanes too!  We will definitely return!

Been feasting at Town & Country Baby Kay's for 10 years - this location offers the same amazing quality Cajun food at great prices.  Quality of Food   The Étouffée = 10 Catfish Sandwich = 10 Chicken and Sausage gumbo = 10   this is the best Cajun food in the valley hands down eat here one time and you're done you're a regular for life - the food is that good

Serves really really tasty Cajun food.  I usually pop in here for lunch, but the flavors from the food the the ambiance reminds you of New Orleans.

The cajun, honey and bbq wings here are super good!  One thing that they make really good is the Catfish sandwich, crispy on the outside with a side of coleslaw.  

I'm not an expert on this, but I am not a fan of their jambalaya, the rice is a bit bland and too fluffy.  The base sauce that goes with it is not the greatest.  Most of the time, the staffs are courteous and attentive.

Overall, it's a great lunch spot.

Great place! Excellent service. When I told the server it was our first time he immediately offered us samples of their most popular dishes - now that's good service! 

The reviews about the etouffee are true. It is slammin and I ate about half of my husband's plate! I got their BBQ shrimp and it was good but the sauce was unique and definitely not your typically BBQ sauce so just go into it knowing that. Great portions.  Side salad was excellent. Wasn't a huge fan of the green olive coleslaw but I had to try it because I've never heard of those flavors put together. Garlic was amazing! 

My biggest reason for giving them 4 instead of 5 stars is kinda petty- they don't have beignets!! And that is so very Cajun and New Orleans. Our server said he had multiple requests for them in the past week so hopefully they start making them soon! If they do, I'll change my review to 5 stars!
Boyfriend took me here for one of our first dates and we come here for special occasions every year. Lovely staff and amazing gumbo

I will never eat here again. I think that there's something suspicious about this place.  It's remaining open with the quality of food doesn't add up.  Something else must be sold there.  The food restaurant is a cover

Baby Kay's is amazing! The service was great. Very friendly and prompt. The crab cakes were delicious and had a great sauce to dip them in. I also really loved the jambalaya and chicken and sausage gumbo. They definitely cook with spice, so if you have trouble with that I probably wouldn't recommend this place. Great flavors with everything we had. If you're interested in dessert, the bread pudding was fabulous, just like everything else.

It is food adventure time or my friends and I again. This time, we were on our quest to try this newly opened Cajun food. When we first walked in, we saw a local musician playing music in the general dining area (what a great way to start our dining experience). The restaurant was extremely busy during business hour and that also means the food is good to me. We started our meal with two different appetizers. I forgot the name of the other one, but one of them was Boudin Balls. I love the apricot-pepper Jelly sauce and the crab cakes was absolutely delicious. As for dinner, I ordered a cajun combination that comes with crawfish etouffee, chicken and sausage jambalaya and substitute seafood gumbo over chicken with a side of green olive salad. All 3 of them were absolutely delicious, especially the crawfish etouffee. I didn't care for the green olive salad but my company seems to like it. 

To complete the cajun dining experience, we ordered a bread pudding dessert and split it between all 6 of us. It was very tasty. If i wasn't so full, I would have probably ordered one just for myself. The reason i didn't give it a 5 star is because our server kept interrupting our conversation every time she came by. I even tried speaking very loudly to my friend the last time she came over and she managed to talk over me anyway. Argh! Can't you wait a little or say "excuse me" at least...?

Overall, I do enjoy my dining experience here and will definitely come back here again.

I had lunch there today with one of the guys from work and had the best shrimp Po' boy I've ever eaten. The Gumbo was amazing and we will working this into our weekly lunch rotation. The service was amazing. Like I was family.

They have a lovely menu.  I would recommend a reservation if you're going to be there on the weekend . The live music is out standing! The man loved the jambalaya, what can I say we love the place! And the sweet tea is delicious!

I had been wanting to try this place for so long and I'm so sorry it took me so long to do so!! The food is SO good! We got the Cajun combo which has the crawfish etoufee, chicken and shrimp gumbo and jambalaya...all of which were so rich in flavor and slightly spicy. YUM. We also got the fried sausage app and loved it. And do not skip the key lime pie for dessert...best key lime pie ever!!! Also they have a good selection of beers from Louisiana which is cool! We will be back SOON!!

After having such a phenomenal 2011 Thanksgiving from Baby Kay's, we were anticipating another wonderful experience this year.  We were greatly disappointed.  Our order included 2 turkeys, gravy, cole slaw, dressing, cranberries and dirty rice.  The difference between this year and last year was so great that we couldn't believe this was the same restaurant. Let me explain. 

The turkeys were good. They tasted the same. The dressing was okay but not as filled with nuts and flavor as last year. We had to add a lot of butter, chicken stock and nuts to make it tasty or even close to last year's savory decadence.  The cranberries lived up to last year's order. They were delicious. The cole slaw was a mason jar ($20) of mayo filled with 1/4 cabbage and 10 green olives minced. It should have been more like a salad and less like a mayo spread.  The dirty rice - last year was sticky long rain rice with many pieces of delicious nuggets of crumbly meat. This year it was white rice, similar to Uncle Ben's, loose and with barely any meat. Last but not least, the gravy. It was so burnt that we called the restaurant and returned it. Imagine eating burnt popcorn with flour, butter and Lawry's gravy seasoning and you'll understand. The second batch was only 40% burnt rather than 75% like the first order.   
 
From the minute thanksgiving ended last year, our family was talking about the amazing meal. This continued to be the topic of conversation over the course of the year.  We were so excited to enjoy the flavorful, mouthwatering food again.   This year, with every bite, we became more and more disappointed.  We tried to understand why it was so different. The only explanation we could come up with is that the chef must have changed.  This meal was not worth $400.  If it was like last year, we could have been charged $800 and we would have been happy to pay for it.  Baby Kay's - I'm writing this email so that you will hopefully read this and go back to your former way of cooking.  Your food was so amazing that I want to give you the chance to go back to your old way of cooking. Please read this Baby Kay's.  I'm rooting for you!

AMAZINGLY DELICIOUS!!!!
I have to say, walking into this place I was blind. Once we were seated we got our drinks served in less than a few minutes. 
Then the waiter was kind enough to explain what some of the options were. Since I had never really had cajun. Once we put our order in of the Fried Shrimp with Dirty Rice & The Seafood Gumbo, it was given to us in maybe 5-10 mins. There was hardly any wait! The food & service was amazing!!! They have a gentleman who was playing blues music live which made for a Great atmosphere! 
We will definitely be back!! This is a restaurant YOU HAVE TO VISIT!!!
